articles.name: Embed Uberflip Analytics into other tools using iframe
articles.title: Embed Uberflip Analytics into other tools using iframe
articles.body:
Ever been working in another tool, wishing you had your Uberflip Analytics data right there for quick reference? If that tool accepts iframed content, you can make that happen. This article shows you how.  

 

Before you begin

  • You must be logged into Uberflip in your browser for embedded dashboards to load in other tools. If you’re not logged in, a login prompt will appear in that tool and allow you to authenticate.
  • The dashboards that are available for iframing (single lead/contact and single company) require Enrichment to be enabled on your account. Without Enrichment, these dashboards will be empty.

 

About Uberflip Analytics embeddable dashboards

Some tools allow you to use an iframe to embed content from other apps. This allows you to use your apps together in a more efficient way. 

Uberflip has created 2 dashboards that can be easily embedded into apps that allow this: 

  1. The single lead/contact dashboard
  2. The single company dashboard

Both dashboards include:

  • Contacts/contact details
  • Company details
  • Lifetime stats
  • Sessions data
  • Items viewed
  • Session details


Image: An Uberflip Analytics dashboard being displayed within Salesforce.

Embed the analytics dashboards

Tools that accept iframed content will each have a different process for embedding iframes. Refer to the knowledge base of your favorite tools to see if iframes are supported, and if so, how to set them up.

Using Salesforce?

Salesforce allows iframed content using their Visualforce tool. Learn about Visualforce and how to embed iframes there.

If your tool allows iframed content, use the URLs below to embed these dashboards:

Dashboard 

About this dashboard 

Embeddable URL 

Single lead/contact

Single visitor details (based on MAP ID)

https://app.uberflip.com/embeds/analytics/single_contact_basic_embed

Single company

Details about a single company (based on company name)

https://app.uberflip.com/embeds/analytics/single_company_basic_embed

 

Salesforce tip

In Salesforce, you can use merge fields in the URL parameters to auto-apply filters based on the page you're viewing (i.e. a contact or company profile)

Example:
https://app.uberflip.com/embeds/analytics/single_contact_basic_embed?email={contact.email}

articles.name: OnBrand - Ticket and Escalation Process
articles.title: OnBrand - Ticket and Escalation Process
articles.body:
Learn how to get help from Uberflip's OnBrand team for customer OnBrand work, and how to escalate urgent issues.

 

Before you begin

  • The processes described in this article are intended for use by any internal Uberflip team.

 

Getting help from the OnBrand team

How do I get support for a customer issue pertaining to Onbrand?

Uberflip's OnBrand team is responsible for all branding and design features of a hub that are not achieved via the platform's settings.  This includes new implementations and updates to existing hubs.

What are OnBrand tickets, and why are they important?

Uberflip's OnBrand team receives a lot of requests for help. To manage all of these requests, and to ensure nothing is missed or forgotten, we use a ticket system in Zendesk. In this system, every request for work is represented by its own ticket.

Using tickets allows us to:

  • Keep track of all requests, so that we can make sure that all requests get a response.
  • Centralize communication related to a request, so that everyone involved has a definitive record of what's been discussed, and so we can ensure that every aspect of the request is addressed.
  • Prioritize requests, so that we can handle the most urgent requests first (but without forgetting about requests that are less urgent, but equally important).
  • Guarantee a response within a specific timeframe. In fact, an Onbrand ticket is the only way to get help from the Onbrand team that has a Service Level Agreement (SLA) behind it.  There is a 4-hour SLA for a first-response out to the customer.
  • Measure the business, so we know how well the OnBrand team is performing, and whether the business is growing.

In short: tickets help the OnBrand team to help you and our customers.

 

Do I really have to submit tickets for OnBrand assistance?

We know that submitting a ticket to OnBrand seems inconvenient compared to just sending a Slack message. But without tickets, things can get missed or lost altogether — and that makes everyone unhappy (especially customers!). This is why we ask you to submit Onbrand tickets: they allow the OnBrand team to do the best possible job for both you and the customer.

 

Where do OnBrand tickets live?

We use Zendesk as our system of record for managing tickets for both product Support and Onbrand. That's why you might also see tickets referred to as "Zendesk tickets".

While it is mainly the Support and OnBrand teams that works in Zendesk, all members of the Customer Experience department also have access to this system to check on the status of open support tickets.

 

Who can submit an Onbrand ticket?

Tickets are to be submitted directly from customers using the Support portal.  Some exceptions to this can be made for bugs identified in-house or for escalations.

 

How does a customer submit an Onbrand ticket?

There are two methods for customers to submit tickets:

  • Email: support@uberflip.com.  Support will intercept these and transfer to OnBrand's ticket queue.   This may have a slight delay in getting to Onbrand's queue for visibility.
  • Help Portal (preferred because it goes straight to the OnBrand queue): https://help.uberflip.com (click on Submit a Request > OnBrand Request)

How does an Uberflip team member submit a ticket?

Follow the the process for submitting an OnBrand support ticket as an Uberflip team member below.

Process: Submit an OnBrand support ticket

Use this process to submit a new ticket.

  1. Log in to Zendesk at https://help.uberflip.com/
  2. Click on +Add, then New > Ticket:
  3. Fill in the fields on the left side:
    • Requester: This is the customer's contact information (the person OnBrand should correspond with about the issue).  This is a very critical piece of information.  Take the time to get this one correct.
    • CCs: Can be added for others who should be copied on all correspondence on this ticket.
    • Form: Select Onbrand Form
    • Customer Name: Enter the company name
    • Account ID: Enter the Uberflip account ID (this is helpful for multi-account customers)
    • Hub ID or Hub URL: Enter the hub ID or URL (also helpful for multi-hub accounts so we can make sure we're looking at the right one)
    • Priority: See Setting priority below.
  4. Describing the issue/request -
    1. If you do not want the customer to be able to see your note, use the Internal Note option (make sure the field turns yellow), then enter a detailed explanation of the issue.  You would use this option if you've flagged a bug internally and the customer may not be aware of it.
    2. If you do want the customer to see your message in the Zendesk ticket, use the Pubic Reply tab
  5. Click on Submit as New to finish submitting the ticket.

 

Internal Note (will only be visible to internal users of Zendesk):

 

Public Reply (The customer contacts included on the ticket will receive this message):

 

 

Setting severity and priority

When you submit an Onbrand support ticket, you will need to specify the priority of the issue:

Priority is a measure of how important an issue is from a business and customer impact perspective which determines the level of escalation.

The Onbrand team relies on these fields to efficiently prioritize requests, so setting the correct priority for your ticket is very important.

For each field, you will need to choose from a list of options. Each of the available options has a definition that outlines its criteria. You can find these below:

 

Priority level definitions

Use this table to help you choose the appropriate priority level for your request ticket. Remember: priority tells us how much the customer cares about this issue (regardless of how broken the affected system is).

Priority Definition
1 - Urgent

Immediate business impact affecting multiple internal initiatives / business objectives. Data loss. Urgently time sensitive issues (i.e. needs to be addressed right now - should be accompanied by an escalation via the #onbrand-escalations channel in Slack).
2 - High

Blockers/issues that cause major impact to the client’s continued use of the platform or affect other business objectives with no workaround. Highly time sensitive issues (2-3 business days).
3 - Normal

Standard support issue or inquiry. This should be used for the majority of tickets.
4 - Low

General questions about the platform. Issues with very little to no impact.

Common mistakes

Here are some common mistakes to avoid when submitting an Onbrand ticket:

  • Filing the ticket under your own name, instead of the customer's:
    When you submit the ticket, remember to set the customer as the Requester, not yourself! We need this information to contact the client, and if it's missing, this causes delays.
  • Creating a ticket by forwarding a customer's email to support@uberflip.com:
    This sets you (not the customer) as the Requester, and could cause delays in responding to the customer. In addition, often the customers email is not clear, or worse, consists of a long thread of messages.  Instead, please follow the instructions above for submitting a ticket and paste the customer's email into the Internal Note field when you create the ticket according to the process above or use the portal.
  • Not providing any or enough details about the issue: If the ticket doesn't have enough information for us to go on, all we can do is ask you or the customer for the missing information. This typically results in back and forth that wastes time and is frustrating for the customer. To avoid this, please include as many details as possible, i.e. which Hub and/or specific assets are affected, steps to reproduce the issue, etc. You should also:
    • Verify that the issue exists as described by the client
    • Describe the issue clearly and concisely in the ticket
    • Provide a clear indication of the impact this issue is having for your client

As a general rule, a good ticket is one where OnBrand can get back to the customer with a first response directly, and does not have to follow up with you first.

 

Escalating Onbrand tickets

What does it mean to escalate an OnBrand ticket?

From time to time, issues come up that are extremely urgent, and need to be resolved as soon as possible. For these issues, you have the ability to escalate an Onbrand ticket.

When you ask for an Onbrand ticket to be escalated, you are effectively telling the OnBrand team:

"I want you to drop what you're doing and work on this ticket ahead of all other ongoing activities."

Is there anything I need to consider before I request an escalation?

While tickets legitimately need to be escalated in some situations, always remember that escalations come at a cost:

  • Escalations are disruptive: they can have a negative effect on productivity due to shifting priorities.
  • Escalations are expensive: they typically require expensive resources (management, developers, etc.) to take time away from their ongoing work to focus exclusively.
  • Escalations result in poor customer experiences: an escalation makes one customer happy, but potentially makes all other customers unhappy because work on their issues has to be delayed.

Before you escalate a ticket, keep the impact in mind and use your judgment to make sure that the situation really does call for an escalation. In some cases, this might mean reaching out to a customer to manage their expectations instead of escalating the ticket.

When should I escalate an OnBrand ticket?

There are many situations where an escalation is warranted, and a comprehensive list of these situations would be impractical and not very useful. As a result, the OnBrand team relies on you to use your judgment as to when an escalation is required.

Below are a few examples of situations that would call for an escalation:

  • The escalation is a bug
  • The issue is high impact such as a non-functional or missing menu/CTAs, or tiles that don't respond to click.
  • The issue could impact churn or revenue, e.g. the customer is at high risk for churning, or will not discuss renewal/upgrade until the issue is resolved.

How do I escalate an OnBrand ticket?

Follow the process for escalating a ticket below.

 

Process: Escalate an OnBrand ticket

Use this process to escalate an existing Onbrand ticket. Remember to use your judgment and make sure it's necessary to escalate the ticket before you proceed.

  1. In Slack, go to the #onbrand-escalations channel.
  2. Click on the Shortcuts button below the message box:

 

  1. Click on the OB Escalation Request shortcut:

 

2. Fill out the form with the details about the OnBrand ticket to be escalated, then click on Submit to post the escalation to the channel:

 

3. The Onbrand Development Coordinator (OBDC) Team Lead will review the escalation request. If it is deemed to be a valid escalation, the current OBDC on the escalated ticket, or the Team Lead will, acknowledge receipt and be in contact with you shortly after.

4. Continue to monitor the ticket until it has been resolved.

 

If you do not receive a response to your escalation within 30 minutes:

If required, reach out to the following individual Onbrand team members using Slack or email, in the following order:

  1. Team Lead, Onbrand Development Coordination
    • Aja Servais (Slack: aja.servais, Email: aja.servais@uberflip.com)
    • If no response:
  2. Director, Professional Services
    • Stacey Kimmett (Slack: stacey.kimmett, Email: stacey.kimmett@uberflip.com)

 

After hours escalations

The operating hours of the OnBrand team are currently 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time, Monday to Friday. Escalations are possible outside of these hours, and follow the normal procedure outlined above.

If you do not receive a response from OnBrand to your after hours escalation within a reasonable timeframe:

  1. Contact your manager. They will directly contact the Team Lead, OnBrand Coordination (Aja Servais), who will coordinate with the OnBrand team.  
  2. Continue to monitor the relevant Zendesk ticket for updates from the OBDC

Additional information

Quick reference: What to do when...

Here's a quick reference guide on what you should do in various common OnBrand-related situations:

When a customer... First, do this: Then, do this:
Asks about an ongoing OnBrand ticket (Zendesk)  Search Zendesk for the relevant OnBrand support ticket and check for updates If there is no recent update in the ticket or you aren't sure, @mention the assigned OBDC in the ticket's internal comments and ask for an update.
Tells you about a new issue they are experiencing with their hub's branding/design Search Zendesk to check if there is already a ticket open about this issue for the customer If there is no existing ticket for the customer, you can  submit one on their behalf but it is strongly encouraged to have customers submit their own tickets via the portal.
Asks for guidance on how to do something in a code block pertaining to custom features and you don't know the answer If you are not sure or comfortable answering code-related questions, that is ok! Ask the customer to submit their questions via the Zendesk portal and an OBDC will assist.
Wants to have new customizations/features added to a hub. Teach the customer how to submit requests directly to OnBrand via the portal Ask the customer to submit their questions via the Zendesk portal and an OBDC will be assigned to assist.
Wants to discuss a rebrand project or review mock-ups to confirm feasibility and/or scope Teach the customer how to submit requests directly to OnBrand via the portal Ask the customer to submit their questions via the Zendesk portal and an OBDC will be assigned to assist and arrange a call.

 

Using Slack for Onbrand support

Your fellow Uberflippers have a lot of knowledge about our product, our company, and our customers, and Slack can be a useful tool for accessing that knowledge. 

Important

Remember that Zendesk tickets are the only official way to get help from the OnBrand team, and the only one where you're guaranteed to get a response within a specific timeframe.

Members of the OnBrand Development Coordination (OBDC) team are typically present in the channels listed below:

 

Channel
 Used for

#onbrand-escalations

 Requesting that a specific ticket, for a specific customer, is given more attention, higher visibility, and a greater sense of urgency.
#onbrand General questions about onBrand process, turnaround times, feature examples etc.  Posting requests for specific work to be done in this channel will not be actioned.  

 

OnBrand Office Hours

OnBrand office hours are held daily Monday-Friday at 9:30am ET on a drop-in basis and everyone is welcome.  An OBDC and developer are in attendance to answer questions such as feasibility or scope of a customer request.

articles.name: What's New at Uberflip
articles.title: What's New at Uberflip
articles.body:
We're continuously working to improve the Uberflip experience - here's a monthly roundup of what new features, improvements to existing features, and fixes that were released. 

 

November, 2022

New & Improved

September, 2022

New & Improved

Add sections to your streams to better organize content and improve the reader experience 

Enjoy more control than ever over how items are presented in streams by organizing content into stream sections. To make it even easier, we have also added multi-select capabilities and the ability to drag and drop groups of items into your new sections. 

Get started optimizing your streams and organize your items into stream sections. 

See who is engaging with your content and create personalized content experiences with Eloqua Enrichment

Without enrichment, you only understand content performance - not who is engaging with that content. By integrating Uberflip with Eloqua, you can better gauge the effectiveness of campaign targeting by being able to see who in your MAP is engaging with your content.

Add Eloqua Enrichment to your subscription to take advantage of these valuable insights. 

Create robust tagging structures with Tag Groups

Take your tagging taxonomy to the next level by grouping like tags into tag groups. Not only will this make it easier for your team to locate the right content, but it will unlock insights into what content captures your audiences attention. 

Create tag groups to

Other Improvements: 

  • Get weekly progress reports on items and stream performance with our new Weekly Newsletter Dashboard. 

In Other News: 

  • Our new Office Hours schedule is out! Get answers and learn how-to's from Uberflip users and product experts during our weekly small-group sessions. See the schedule and register for sessions. 

Introducing our newest app, Enhanced Tag Manager!

Tag management is fundamental to great content strategy. Our newest app levels up your content organization by making tag management more intuitive and accessible to your team.

Enhanced Tag Manager enables your team to define a tagging framework and tag content at scale - making it easier for your team to find and share marketing-approved content and increase the buying journey velocity. 

Install Enhanced Tag Manager and follow the guided setup to get started. 

Generate more leads with improved CTA functionality

Using CTAs to bring more leads into your funnel is now easier with improvements to the CTA search function and CTA positioning. Now, you can search for a CTA and drag-and-drop it into the stream without altering the positioning of the other items within the stream. 

We also fixed a UI bug on the CTA's "Repeat After Every" checkbox, now making it possible for users to set CTAs to repeat after a certain number of items are viewed within a stream. 

Learn more about engaging your visitors by adding CTAs to your streams.

Improved Marketing Stream information within Activity Logs 

Activity Logs now differentiate archived Marketing Streams from deleted Marketing Streams, matching the terminology used in other parts of the application.

This differentiation between archived Marketing Streams and permanently deleted Marketing Streams will reduce confusion for all users while reviewing the User Activity Logs. 

Learn more about generating more leads using Marketing Streams. 

Other Improvements: 

  • Share slideshow presentations, infographics, videos and other branded materials within your Uberflip streams by adding a SlideShare source stream. 
  • When creating a new Stream, Marketing and Sales Streams are now referred to as Curated Streams instead of Landing Page Streams. 
  • From the Deleted Items View, you can now search for deleted items by Item ID. 
  • Hide your items' publish date on your recommendation templates by selecting "Hide Publish Date" within Display Options when editing a Recommendation Template. 
  • New Marketing Streams will be created by default with the SEO Setting for "Enable Canonical Meta Tag" set to TRUE. 
  • Updated image formats and changes to how Uberflip stores and renders images were made to improve image performance. 

In Other News: 

  • Uberflip has launched Office Hours for customers looking for best practices, practical how-to's, and to connect directly with product experts and other power users. Save your seat!

articles.name: Changes to new and returning visitor data in UFA [Aug. 2022]
articles.title: Changes to new and returning visitor data in UFA [Aug. 2022]
articles.body:
What is changing?

As of Aug. 10th 2022, new and returning visitor data will be tracked a bit differently in Uberflip Analytics. 

Previously, Hub visitors who came in and returned on the same day were counted as both new and returning visitors. But this calculation makes the returning visitor number look more robust, in a way that may not be significant to most users.

To remedy this, a visitor will now only be counted as returning if they come back after 24 hours. 

 

Will this affect my UFA data?

Yes, new and returning visitor metrics will change slightly. This would affect any metric that factors in these stats as well. 

With this change, you’re likely to see:

  • A slight increase in the number of new visitors 
  • A decrease in the number of returning visitors 

 

Does this affect my historical data as well?

Yes, all new and returning visitor data will be adjusted to the new standard. This means previously captured data will change as well.

articles.name: Import content into Uberflip
articles.title: Import content into Uberflip
articles.body:
Content is the backbone of any content experience (no content, no experience). In Uberflip, you can pull content in from several sources. This gives you the ability to then curate and distribute that content as personalized experiences for any audience. 

After you've connected a content source, that source remains connected to Uberflip. This means that when content is added or updated at the source, it's also added/updated in your Uberflip account!

This article shows you how to connect content sources to Uberflip, so you can import your digital marketing assets.

Note

Want to create blog posts from scratch in Uberflip? Check out: Create a Blog Stream

 

Before you begin

  • You must be an Account Admin or Content Manager to import content into Uberflip

 

What can I import?

There are 7 content sources you can import from with Uberflip: 

  • Blogs (using an RSS feed)
  • Flipbook folders (for Flipbooks and PDFs)
  • Vidyard  
  • Wistia  
  • YouTube 
  • Vimeo 
  • Brightcove 

SlideShare Streams have been retired

The ability to create new SlideShare Streams has ended. Check out SlideShare Streams are being retired [Nov. 2023] for details. 

Import content into Uberflip

The process for importing content from each source is a bit different, but it always begins the same way. So let’s start there: 

  1. In the Hub you want to add content to, head to the Content page if you’re not already there (found in the sidebar navigation)
  2. Click New Stream (in the Streams tab)
  3. Choose the content source you want to import from in the Source Streams list
  4. A modal screen specific to the content type you’ve selected will open

From here, the process changes for each content source. Expand the section for your chosen content source below to continue:

Blog posts (RSS feed)

Before you begin: Prepare your external blog for importing into Uberflip

Default RSS settings are often not configured to include all articles, or may not include images.

To get the best results when importing external blog content, we recommend optimizing the RSS feed settings before creating the Blog Stream in Uberflip. 

After the RSS feed is optimized, use the steps below to import it into Uberflip: 

  1. In the first text field, enter the URL for your external blog's RSS feed
  2. In the Advanced Options section, you can configure various options for this Blog Stream by checking the applicable boxes. See below for more information about the available options.
    • By default, all options are disabled (unchecked). You don't need to enable any of these options to proceed.
    • The Start from scratch option allows you to create an empty Blog Stream, rather than importing content. See below for more information.
  3. Click Create
  4. Uberflip will begin importing posts from your blog. When it's done, you'll see a confirmation message. To view the Items that were imported, click View Stream.

That's it! Your blog content has been imported into your Hub. And all new posts added to that RSS feed in the future will be imported automatically.

Blog Stream Options

When you create a new Blog Stream that imports content from an external blog, you can enable various options. Here's what each option does:

  • Start from scratch: Enable this option to create a new, empty Blog Stream that you can post to from within Uberflip. See below for more instructions. Enabling this option automatically disables all the options below.
  • Allow small images to be used for thumbnails: By default, images must be at least 180 px x 100 px to be used as thumbnail images for Items (posts) in a Blog Stream. If your thumbnails are smaller than this, you can enable this option to use them anyway.
  • Automatically match author profiles: If the authors of the content on the external blog also exist as authors in Uberflip, enabling this option will match the appropriate Uberflip author profiles to the imported content.
  • Allow class attributes, style and font tags to be imported: By default, Uberflip strips out CSS class attributes and other tags when importing external content. Enable this option to keep these elements intact in the content after import. Note that any referenced classes, fonts, etc. must be defined in your Hub's Custom Code for the corresponding formatting to be retained.
  • Automatically create and apply tags from RSS to items: Enable this option to automatically create Uberflip tags from any tags contained in the RSS feed.
Flipbook folders (Flipbooks and PDFs)

In Uberflip, Flipbooks Streams can be made from Flipbook folders.

If you already have a Flipbook folder ready to be turned into a Stream, select it from the dropdown in the Add a Flipbooks Stream modal. Then click Import.

If you want to upload a new PDF, you can do so with the steps below: 

  1. In the content modal, click Upload PDF
  2. The Create new Flipbook window will appear, where you will be on the Choose File page
  3. Use the tabs on the left to choose your upload method. You can use any of the following methods to upload your PDF:
    • From My Computer: Use this option if you have the PDF file stored on your computer.
    • Import from URL: If your PDF file is stored on a web server where it is directly accessible using a link, use this option to paste in the link. Note that FTP is not supported. To upload files via FTP, see this article.
    • From Dropbox/Box/Google Drive: Choose one of these options to connect a cloud storage account where the file is stored. When using one of these methods, you can choose to upload multiple PDFs at once.
  4. When you've selected your PDF file, click Next
  5. Now on the Settings page:
    1.  Choose a folder for your Flipbook. Your flipbook will be kept in this folder, and will be added to any Stream created from this folder. All folder settings will apply to this Flipbook.
    2. Name your Flipbook in the field provided (this will be pre-populated using the filename of the PDF)
    3. Under When your should your Flipbook publish/activate, choose whether you want it to become available immediately after it is uploaded, or choose a specific date and time on which to publish it instead
  6. Click Next when you're ready to proceed
  7. Now on the Options page, choose whether you want to run an Auto-Link job on your new Flipbook
    • See this article to learn about the Auto-Link tool.
  8. Click Upload

After uploading, you'll be returned to the Manage Folder view. You'll see the new Flipbook listed here, where it will initially be shown as being in processing. Depending on the size of the PDF, this may take a few minutes.

When the Flipbook is published, it'll be added to any Stream created from that Flipbook folder.

Tip

Want to start editing your Flipbook right away? From the Manage Folder page, Click on the PDF. Then click Load in Page Editor (found under Flipbook options).

Check out Get started with the Flipbook Page Editor to learn about editing Flipbooks.

Vidyard videos
  1. You'll now see the Add a Vidyard Stream screen. Paste your Vidyard API token into the field provided.
  2. Click Import
  3. Uberflip will begin importing players from the Vidyard account associated with that token. When it's done, you'll see a confirmation message. To view the Items that were created for these players, click View Stream 

That's it! Your Vidyard content has been imported into your Hub, and is now available to be included in the content experiences you create. 

Tip

Does your Vidyard account contain a lot of players? By default, Vidyard Streams will pull in a maximum of 50 players. If you need to import more than that, please contact Uberflip Support for help.

Wistia videos

First time connecting to Wistia:

Click the Connect button. A login or authorization window will appear. Follow the steps to connect your Wistia account to Uberflip.

When done, the browser window will close automatically, and you'll be returned to the Content section of Uberflip, with a message that Wistia was successfully connected. You're ready to create your Wistia Streams.

When Wistia is connected: 

  1. In the Streams tab of the Content page, click New Stream
  2. Select Wista again in the Source Streams list
  3. The Add a Wistia Stream modal will open
  4. Under Import Videos by Project, click the dropdown box and select the project you want to import videos from into this Stream.
  5. Uberflip will begin importing videos from the selected project (up to 100 most recent). When it's done, you'll see a confirmation message that shows the number of videos that were imported.

    To view the content Items that were created for these players, click on the View Stream button

That's it! Content from the selected Wistia project has been imported into your Hub, and is now available to be included in your content experiences. New videos uploaded to the connected project will be imported automatically. 

If you want to bring in content from other projects, simply create additional Wistia Streams.

YouTube videos

First time importing videos from YouTube:

You'll see a Connect button in the content modal. Clicking this will open a Google account login window. Login as you normally would to connect to YouTube.

After you've successfully logged in, you'll see a success message and be brought back to the Content page.


When YouTube is connected:

  1. In the Streams tab of the Content page, click the New Stream button
  2. In the modal that opens, click YouTube in the Source Streams list
  3. The Add a YouTube Stream modal will open
  4. Click on the dropdown box, and choose what you want to import:

    Note

    You can import public and unlisted videos (including live streams), but not private videos.

    1. Import all your videos: Select the All Videos option to import all videos from the connected YouTube channel
    2. Import a playlist: Select a playlist from the list of playlists in the connected YouTube channel to import just the videos from that playlist
  5. Once you have selected an option, Uberflip will begin importing videos. When this is done, you'll see a confirmation message that shows the number of videos that were imported.
  6. To view the content Items that were created for these videos, click on the View Stream button

That's it! Your YouTube videos have been imported into your Hub, and are now available to be included in the content experiences you create.

The YouTube Stream you create will remain connected to either the channel or the playlist you chose, and will continue to pull in any new content you publish there automatically.

Vimeo videos

First time connecting to Vimeo:

If it's your first time connecting your Vimeo account, use these steps to connect.

  1. Click the Connect button
  2. A Vimeo login page will open. Log in to the Vimeo account you want to connect using any of the available options
    • If you're already logged in to Vimeo you won't see this screen, so skip ahead to the next step. Make sure you're logged in to the account you want to connect to Uberflip!
  3. In the Vimeo Authorize screen that appears, click Allow to confirm that you want to give Uberflip access your Vimeo account

When Vimeo is connected: 

  1. In the Streams tab of the Content page, click New Stream
  2. Click Vimeo again in the Source Streams list
  3. Because your Vimeo account is already connected, you'll now see the Add a Vimeo Stream screen
  4. Under Create a Stream from, click the dropdown and choose what you want to import from your account
  5. Click Import
  6. Uberflip will begin importing videos. When this is done, you'll see a confirmation message that shows the number of videos that were imported. To view the content Items that were created for these videos, click View Stream.

That's it! Your Vimeo videos have been imported into your Hub, and are now available to be included in the content experiences you create.

Brightcove videos
  1. In the Add a Brightcove Stream screen that appears, paste in the Account Number, Client ID, and Client Secret that you copied from Brightcove into the fields provided
  2. Click Connect when you're ready
  3. Click the Select a Player dropdown to choose the player that contains the videos you want to import
  4. After you've select a player, the Import a Playlist dropdown will appear. Click the dropdown and select the playlist you want to import videos from
  5. Uberflip will begin importing videos from the Brightcove account(s) associated with the client you used. When it's done, you'll see a confirmation message that shows the number of videos that were imported.

    To view the content Items that were created for these players, click View Stream.

That's it! Your Brightcove content has been imported into your Hub, and is now available to use in your content experiences. The Stream will remain connected to your Brightcove playlist, and will pull in new content you publish there automatically.

Each Brightcove Stream you create pulls videos from one playlist in one Brightcove player. You can import videos from multiple Brightcove playlists by creating multiple Brightcove Streams.

Remember, Once you've connected a content source, that source remains connected to Uberflip. When content is added or updated at the source, it'll also be added/updated in your Uberflip account.

articles.name: Item tags and Tag Groups explained
articles.title: Item tags and Tag Groups explained
articles.body:
What are Item tags?

In Uberflip, you can add tags to all content Items in your Hub. Tags are simply keywords used to categorize content, and tagged Items are associated with that keyword/category. A piece of content may have multiple tags if it fits multiple categories.  

You can use tags to:

  • Quickly spin-up Streams for key areas
  • Allow Hub Search to find Items based on tags
  • Use Smart Filters to easily manage your content 

A few things to know about tags:

  • Tags can be added to Items only — they can't be added to Streams
  • By default, tags are not visible on the frontend (i.e. to visitors to your Hub). If you want to show tags (or Item labels based on tags) in your Hub/Streams, custom options are available. Speak with your account manager.
  • Tags are account-wide: if you have multiple Hubs, any tags you create will be usable across all Hubs, and tags created in any Hub will be shown in the list of existing tags in the Tags Manager

 

What are Tag Groups?

Simply put, Tag Groups are collections of tags with similar intents. They’re fully customizable and can be based on any topic or parameter you want. Tag Groups can contain as many tags as you need. 

Examples of Tag Groups could be:

  1. An ‘Industry’ Tag Group, which contains industry tags, such as: ‘aerospace’, ‘retail’, and ‘manufacturing’
  2. An ‘Asset’ Tag Group containing tags such as: ‘Brochure’, or ‘Report’
  3. A ‘Stage’ Tag Group, containing the tags ‘TOFU’, ‘MOFU’, and ‘BOFU’ 

Ultimately, the Tag Groups are up to you. 

When tags are nestled cozily in Tag Groups, you have a tag structure.

 

What is a tag structure?

Your tag structure is how your tags and Tag Groups come together to form a logical way of categorizing content. 

An effective tagging structure should be simple and intuitive. And when done properly, a tagging structure is easy to implement and maintain over time.

Example tag structure: 

To easily build and maintain your tagging structure, we suggest using Uberflip’s Enhanced Tag Manager app.

articles.name: Enhanced Tag Manager: user guide
articles.title: Enhanced Tag Manager: user guide
articles.body:
Having a properly implemented tagging structure in Uberflip makes it easier to find and utilize the content you need, when you need it. With Uberflip’s Enhanced Tag Manager app, this has gotten almost too easy. This article will show you how it works. 

 

Before you begin

  • Enhance Tag Manager is an app available in the Uberflip Marketplace. You must download it to your Uberflip account to use it. 
  • To use Enhanced Tag Manager, your Uberflip account must have API access. This feature is included with certain pack types, or may be added on to your Uberflip subscription. To learn more, speak with your Uberflip account representative. 
  • There are several Uberflip permissions that affect a user's experience in Enhanced Tag Manager. Expand the section below to see what’s needed.
    Permission requirements for Enhanced Tag Manager

    * = required 

    • API Access* (granted to Admins by default)
    • View Hubs > 
      • Custom Code*  (granted to Admins and Content Managers by default) 
      • Manage Tags* (granted to Admins and Content Managers by default)
    • Current User > 
      • View* (granted to Admins and Content Managers by default)
      • Global Permission > List and Export* (granted to Admins and Content Managers by default)
    • Hub > Custom Code >
      • Create* (granted to Admins and Content Managers by default)
      • View* (granted to Admins and Content Managers by default)
    • App User > 
      • List and export: Users with this permission can view and edit app-wide settings for this app in the Installed Apps page of Uberflip. 
    • Enhanced Tag Manager* (granted to Admins by default) >
      • Modify tag structure (granted to Admins by default): Users with this permission to create or edit Tag Groups in the app. Without it, users can still use the app to view and apply tags, but can’t make changes to the tagging structure.

 

Why use Enhanced Tag Manager?

Enhanced Tag Manager can help with all of your tag management needs. These can be broken into two general areas:

  1. Organizing your Tag Groups & tag structure 
  2. Tagging content 

More specifically, Enhanced Tag Manager can: 

  • Help you define a tagging structure for your needs
  • Help you build said tagging structure
  • Allow admins more control over how their tag structure is used on content
  • Allow users tagging content to apply the tag structure more easily and consistently

And with your tagging structure properly implemented, you’ll benefit from:

  • Having a better overview of your content library as a whole
  • The ability to quickly find the right content for specific audiences
  • The ability to find and fill gaps in your content strategy
  • The ability to measure the performance of your content strategy more granularly

Effectively tagged content is ready to be found, utilized, updated, or even retired quickly–giving your team more time for other things. Enhanced Tag Manager makes tagging and tag management simple. 

To learn more about tags, check out: Tags explained

 

Organize tags:

In the Organize Tags tab of Enhanced Tag Manager, admins can:

  • Create new Tag Groups 
  • Delete Tag Groups 
  • Add/remove existing tags in Tag Groups 
  • Create new tags

Non-admin users can view Tag Groups, but they can't create or edit them.

Note

While you can use Enhanced Tag Manager to remove tags from content, tags cannot be deleted from Uberflip within the Enhanced Tag Manager app. Tags must be deleted in Uberflip.

Don’t forget to apply your changes!

When working in the Organize Tags tab, changes made to Tag Groups aren’t saved until you click Apply Changes in the main window. Before that, all changes are pending, and highlighted with an orange dot.

 

Create a new Tag Group 

If you already have a tagging structure plan, use the steps below to add or edit Tag Groups.

Not sure where to start?

Enhanced Tag Manager’s tag structure wizard can guide you! This will open automatically the first time you open Enhanced Tag Manager, but can be skipped if not needed.

If you do want help creating a personalized tag structure template at any time, you can relaunch the wizard by clicking Help me set up a tagging structure in the Organize Tags tab.

  1. In the Organize Tags page, click Add Tag Group 
  2. In the panel that appears, use the dropdown menu to select from commonly used Tag Groups, or enter a custom group name
  3. Optional: Enter a Tag Group description
  4. Click Edit Tags
  5. Find and select existing tags you want to add to this group. If a tag you search for doesn’t already exist, the Create new Tag button will become active–click it to create the tag
  6. When your tags have been selected, click Done
  7. Set the display option and rules for this group:
    • Sort Order: Choose how tags in this Tag Group should be sorted when tagging. You can sort alphabetically or by creation date.
    • Set as Required: Choose whether a tag from this group is required for every Item
    • Max. tags per item: Enter the maximum number of tags from this Group that can be applied to an Item. Or turn the toggle off if you don’t want to restrict the use of tags in this group. 
  8. Click Save
  9. Back on the main page, for your Tag Group to be created, you must click Apply Changes > Confirm

And just like that, your Tag Group has been created!

 

Edit Tag Groups (and the tags within them)

  1. In the Organize Tags page, find an existing Tag Group, and click Edit beside it
  2. The Tag Group settings panel will appear 
  3. Make the desired changes to the Tag Group
  4. To add or remove tags from the group, click Edit Tags, make your changes, then click Done
  5. Click Save 
  6. Back on the main page, for your Tag Group to be updated, you must click Apply Changes > Confirm 

Done! 

 

Delete a Tag Group

To delete a Tag Group, find it on the Organize Tags page, and click Delete beside it.

Important

When a Tag Group is deleted, the tags within it will be moved back into the ’unassigned tags’ group, which exists as a default in your Uberflip account. The tags will remain on any Items they’re applied to.

 

Tag content:

A great tagging structure means nothing if the tags aren’t applied to Items. Enhanced Tag Manager can help with this. 

In the Tag Content tab of Enhanced Tag Manager, you’ll find a filterable list of all the content in your account. 

You’ll also see current stats for how much of your content is tagged based on the rules set within your Tag Groups. This is called the completion score.

 

Completion score explained 

Your completion score outlines how much of your content has been tagged according to the rules set in your Tag Groups. This is the percentage of Items containing tags from Tag Groups that are set as required. You’ll also see a breakdown of completion for Flipbooks, videos, and blogs. 

By default, you’ll see the account-wide completion score displayed at the top of the Tag Content tab.

To see the completion score specific to a Hub, click the Hub dropdown and select a Hub. 

Completion Score also shows as a score on individual Items in the app. This score is based on how many required Tag Group tags have been applied to that Item. 

Example

If you have two Tag Groups set as required, and an Item has a tag from one of those groups, the completion score would be 50%. Adding a tag from the second required Tag Group would then move the completion score to 100%. 

 

Tag Items

When you have Items that need tags, Enhanced Tag Manager can make tagging quick and simple. Here’s how:

  1. In the Tag Content page, use the available controls (search, selectors, and filters) to find Items that need to be tagged

    Tip: Quick Filters

    Quick filters allow you to easily apply popular filter criteria like recently added, or low completion. Selecting a quick filter will override any currently selected filter options.

  2. From the list that forms, select the Items you want to tag. You can choose to select all shown by checking the box in the list header row, or select Items one by one.
    Note: A dropdown below the list allows you to work with more rows.
  3. Click Tag Selected Items to open your ‘To do list’
  4. Select an Item in the list. You’ll see a preview of the Item and your Tag Groups

    Note: Tag Groups set as required count towards your completion score. 
  5. Click tags that are not highlighted to add them to the Item. Or click highlighted tags to remove them.

    Found an Item that's reached the end of its usefulness? 

    Switch on the Mark for retirement toggle to apply the ‘retire’ tag, and eliminate the need for further tagging. Customize the ‘retire’ tag in the app settings.

  6. Click Apply Tags

When you click Apply Tags, that Item will move to the completed list and the next Item in the to-do list will load. 

Keep going until your to-do list is complete. When done, create another list of priority Items and keep tagging. The more you tag, the more your completion score will increase.

Tip: Quick Tagging Mode

Need to just quickly apply tags to (or check the current tags on) a single Item? No need to build a to-do list: just click on any Item in the table on the Tag Content page to enter the tagging view for just that Item.

 

Notifications

In the Tag Content tab, Enhanced Tag Manager will display notifications when it finds errors, like Items that are breaking your Tag rules. These will help you stick to your rules and tag structure.

To dismiss a notification, just click the X on it. 

Notifications that are still active, but have been dismissed, will appear in the notification center, shown as a bell icon in the control bar. Click there to open your dismissed notifications, so you tackle the issues they highlight.

 

App settings

There are two app-wide settings (retirement tag and strict tagging rules) that are controlled in the Installed apps section of Uberflip. Admins (and any user with the App User > List and export permission) can edit these settings. Expand the section below to learn more.

Edit app-wide settings
  1. In the Uberflip topbar, hover over Marketplace, then click Installed Apps
  2. Find Enhanced Tag Manager in the app list, and click the edit (pencil) icon beside it
  3. On this settings page you’ll find two settings you can change:

    Set custom “Mark for retirement” tag:
    This setting allows you to enter a custom tag for Items you want to retire. By default, the tag is Retire, but you can enter any tag name you’d like.

    While tagging content in the Enhanced Tag Manager app, turning on the Mark for retirement toggle will apply this tag to the Item. This will make it easier for content auditors to find and archive outdated Items.

    Use strict tagging rules validation for required tag groups:
    When enabled, this setting prevents users from applying tags to an Item until they’ve selected at least one tag from every tag group set as required.

articles.name: Add a user to your Uberflip account
articles.title: Add a user to your Uberflip account
articles.body:
Want to add users to your account so colleagues can create pages, DSRs, content, and Streams? Here’s how: 

Before you begin

  • By default, only Account Admins can create users, but they can also give users in other groups permission to create users.

Add a user

  1. Log in to your Uberflip admin account (or an account enabled to add users by an admin)
  2. In the top right corner, hover over your name to expand the menu, then click Account Settings
  3. In the sidebar menu, click Organization, then click Users
  4. Click + New User
  5. This will open the Add User modal. Begin by typing in the new users first and last name
  6. Enter the new users email address 
  7. Optional: If your organization uses single-sign On (SSO), you can add a Federation ID for this user
  8. Under Groups, use the dropdown menu to select the user groups to assign your new user to
    Note: If you don't select any user groups, the user won't be able to use any Uberflip features.
  9. Click Add User

That’s it! Your new user will receive an email, allowing them to create a password and log in.

 

What’s next? 

Once the user is created, you'll see the Edit User page. Here you can make changes to the user's account if needed. You can edit their: 

  • User Information 
  • Bio 
  • Permissions 
  • Licenses 

You can return to the Edit User page anytime by going to Account Settings > Organization > Users, then find the user in the list and click the Edit (pencil) icon beside their name.

articles.name: Announcement: The Uberflip Chrome extension & Outlook add-in have been retired [Dec. 2022]
articles.title: Announcement: The Uberflip Chrome extension & Outlook add-in have been retired [Dec. 2022]
articles.body:
What is changing?

As of Dec. 18th, 2022, the Uberflip Chrome extension and Outlook add-in (extension) have been retired. While previously installed versions of these extensions may still function after that date, their use will not be support by Uberflip in any way.  

Note: While the final versions of the extensions was supported until Dec 18th, 2022, updates, maintenance, and new downloads ended on Sept. 19th 2022. 

Why is this changing?

Most functionalities of the Uberflip Chrome & Outlook extensions are now available in Uberflip’s Sales Assist app.

Sales Assist enables Sales reps to quickly build, share, and monitor personalized Streams for prospects. 

Since its release in 2021, Sales Assist has become the go-to extension for Sales reps who want to quickly build and share Streams. Because of this, we’ve decided to focus on the continued expansion of that tool. Sales Assist can do all the things the Uberflip extensions do, but with many more features to back it up.

How can I continue to easily share Streams?

Moving forward, you can access this and many other features by installing the Sales Assist app. Get in touch with your Uberflip account manager to learn more.

You can also continue to build and share Sales Streams natively in the Uberflip platform.

What is Sales Assist?

Sales Assist is Uberflip's next-generation sales engagement tool. Marketing teams use Uberflip to create content, and Sales Assist empowers sales representatives with that content by making it easy to find and use at any point during the sales cycle.

With Sales Assist, you can:

  • Easily find content your prospects will love (or create your own)
  • Personalize content in seconds
  • Deliver content to prospects through personalized destinations (Streams)
  • Track engagement on content you've shared in real time with notifications

Sales Assist works within your existing sales workflows and tools, so it seamlessly integrates into your day-to-day and won't slow you down. To learn more, check out: Sales Assist: Get started as a Sales User.

articles.name: Sales Assist: Auto-archive inactive DSRs and Items
articles.title: Sales Assist: Auto-archive inactive DSRs and Items
articles.body:
Want to declutter your Uberflip account by archiving old, dead Digital Sales Rooms (DSRs) and Items your reps have created? Sales Assist can do that for you automatically! This article will outline the feature and show you how to set it up.

 

Before you begin 

  • Only Sales Assist admins can turn auto-archiving on/off 
  • Auto-archiving applies to all DSRs and “special blog Stream” Items in the Hubs associated with your Sales Assist account. It cannot be set up for a single user, environment, or DSR.
  • This feature applies to all Sales Streams in Hubs associated with your Sales Assist environments. This includes Sales Streams that were created outside of Sales Assist. 

 

How it works 

The basics:

Every Saturday, an algorithm will scan through your DSRs/Sales Streams within the associated Hubs. Based on the day range you’ve selected, it'll automatically archive any Sales Streams, DSRs, or rep-authored Items that have been ‘inactive’ longer than your selected day range. 

The specifics:

Here's how the algorithm decides what to archive. Every Saturday, it will:

    1. Look for the 100 oldest DSR/Sales Streams (in order of modified date)
    2. IF: The modified date of a DSR/Sales Stream exceeds the set day range
      AND: There’s no share activity in last 90 days
      THEN: The DSR/Sales Stream will be automatically archived

      Note:       The Stream can be recovered in app.uberflip.com if needed
    3. Once it's done with DSR/Sales Streams, it’ll then scan any "special blog streams" (this is where rep-authored Items are held) in each environment and will:
    4. Look for the oldest 100 Items (in order of modified date)
    5. IF: The modified date exceeds the set day range
      AND: There’s no share activity in the last 90 days
      AND: The Item is not currently part of any active DSR/Sales Stream or a Marketing Stream
      THEN: The Item (and its associated files) will be deleted

      Note: Deleted Items can be recovered in app.uberflip.com if needed, but Item files cannot. Check out Recover Deleted Items and Archived Streams to learn more.

Turn auto-archiving on/off

Important

Only Sales Assist admins can enable/disable auto-archiving. If you’re not an admin in Sales Assist, reach out to one and request that they enable this feature. 

    1. Login to Sales Assist with your Sales Assist admin Uberflip account 
    2. Click Admin 
    3. Select the Defaults tab
      Note:       At this point, you must have All Users selected in the top right. Auto-archiving must be set for all users.
    4. Enable auto-archiving:
      Under “Auto Archive Digital Sales Rooms and Custom Items not modified in over”, select a day range for how long a Sales Stream, DSRs, or rep-authored Item should be inactive before being archived

      Disable auto-archiving:
      Under “Auto Archive Digital Sales Rooms and Custom Items not modified in over”, click the dropdown menu and choose -select-
    5. Click the Save icon (floppy disk)

articles.name: Internal: Logging in and out of Uberflip Marketplace
articles.title: Internal: Logging in and out of Uberflip Marketplace
articles.body:
While app.uberflip.com and the Uberflip Marketplace are intrinsically linked, they’re not the same thing. These are actually two different apps, with different sessions and cookies associated with each. 

Because of this you can be logged into Uberflip with one account, but logged into the Marketplace with another. This can cause problems and lost data. 

This article outlines the issues that may arise and best practices to avoid them. 

What’s happening?

When you log into Uberflip and head to the Marketplace, you’ll automatically be logged into the Marketplace with your Uberflip credentials. Simple!

But if you then log out of Uberflip, you will not be automatically logged out of the Marketplace. That’s because this is actually a different web app that’s being displayed within Uberflip.

As an Uberflip employee, it’s likely you’ll at times sign out of one Hub to log into another. But when you log into a new Hub, the Marketplace session persists from the previous log in, and won’t be overridden by logging into a new Hub.

So now you’re logged into a Hub with one set of credentials, but you’re logged into the Marketplace with another. Any changes you make in the Marketplace will apply to the Hub connected to that Marketplace session. 

Why is this an issue?

If you’ve logged into a new Hub, but Marketplace is still logged into a session from another Hub, any changes you make will apply to the Hub you were previously logged into.

This means that if you install, uninstall, update or edit a Marketplace app, you’re doing so for the previous Hub, not the one you’re currently logged into.

Example: You may want to delete an app from the Hub you’re currently working in, but if the Marketplace is still logged into a previous session, you would be deleting it from the previous Hub. This could cause broken functionality and lost data in that Hub. It can also cause confusion and frustration when expected changes don’t occur in the Hub you’re in. 

This can create serious issues if you were previously working in a client or public Uberflip Hub. We suggest not working in Marketplace when logged into the admin backend, unless proper precautions have been taken.  

How do I avoid issues?

To avoid cross-account issues, be sure you’re not carrying a Marketplace session between Hubs. Here are a few ways you can do this: 

  • Use an incognito/private browsing window for each Hub/Marketplace session you open
  • Clear your cookies (or just the specific Uberflip cookies) when logging in or out of an Uberflip Hub
  • Go to https://app.uberflip.com/marketplace and click Log out (top right) to end the current session before working within a new Hub session

articles.name: Create or edit a custom Hub menu
articles.title: Create or edit a custom Hub menu
articles.body:
Menus help you organize your content contextually, making it easier for your visitors to find what they’re looking for. Creating a Custom menu in Uberflip lets you fully customize and build your Hub’s navigation and content collections exactly how you want. This article will show you how it’s done.

Important

With a custom menu, any newly added Streams need to be manually added to your menu.

Create a Custom Menu

  1. In Uberflip, select Appearance from the sidebar menu, then click Menu
  2. Toggle Menu Settings to Custom
    Note: Default Hub menu settings means everything will be updated automatically based on your Streams.
  3. Under Custom Menu Structure, you can begin creating your custom menu

Add a new menu item

  1. At the bottom of the Custom Menu Structure section, click the rectangular box labeled + Add Menu Item

  2. In the modal that opens, choose to add either:
    • a section head (which can have other categories nested under it)
    • a website 
    • a stream link

  3. Fill out the needed information for your selection:
    Section Head Website Stream Link
    Label (required): The text that appears in the menu
    Class name (optional): Used for custom coding
    Link (optional): Link to an existing Stream
    Icon (required): An icon to represent this item
    URL (required): The destination URL when the menu item is clicked
    Label (required): The text that appears in the menu
    Class name (optional): Used for custom coding
    Icon (required): An icon to represent this item

     

    Linking to your homepage?

    To add a link back to your homepage, use the "Stream Link" option and select "All (Hub Home)" in the Stream dropdown. Other methods of homepage linking may bypass important homepage functionalities built into Uberflip. 
    Stream (required): Link to an existing Stream
    Label (required): The text that appears in the menu
    Class name (optional): Used for custom coding
    Icon (required): An icon to represent this item

     

    Linking to your homepage?

    To add a link back to your homepage, use this "Stream Link" option and select "All (Hub Home)" in the Stream dropdown. Other methods of homepage linking may bypass important homepage functionalities built into Uberflip.
  4. Click Add to Menu

 

Add a nested menu item

    1. In the Custom Menu Structure section, find the menu item you want to add a nested item to
    2. Under the item (and any current nested items), click the smaller rectangular box labeled + Add Nested Menu Item
    3. In the modal that opens, choose to add either:
      • a website 
      • a stream link
    4. Fill out the needed information for your selection:
      Website Stream link 
      URL (required): The destination URL when the menu item is clicked
      Label (required): The text that appears in the menu
      Class name (optional): Used for custom coding
      Stream (required): Link to an existing Stream
      Label (required): The text that appears in the menu
      Class name (optional): Used for custom coding

Rearrange menu items

Once your menu items have been added, re-arrange them however you'd like by drag-and-dropping them on the menu editor page. 

Now, you have full control over the way your content is organized and displayed.

You can freely switch between the default menu and the custom menu you’ve created at any time—your custom menu settings will be saved for future use.

 

Delete or edit a menu item

Edit a menu item: 

Head to the Menu settings page (Appearance > Menu) and click the pencil icon on any menu item to edit it.

Delete a menu item:

Head to the Menu settings page (Appearance > Menu) and click the trash icon on any menu item to delete it.

articles.name: Create and share a Marketing Stream
articles.title: Create and share a Marketing Stream
articles.body:
Turn scattered marketing assets into focused content experiences with Marketing Streams. Marketing Streams are inbound destinations where future prospects can consume curated content relevant to them.

Before you begin

  • To work with Marketing Streams, you must be a member of the Account Administrators, or Content Managers user groups.

About Marketing Streams

Your marketing team creates a ton of content, designed to generate leads. Instead of hoping the right people find the right pieces, use Uberflip to create content experiences. This basically means presenting relevant content in a way that is attractive, structured, and engaging.

A Marketing Stream is essentially a self-contained, curated collection of relevant content created for a specific audience.

Once created, your Marketing Stream can be accessed from a unique (and customizable) URL. 

Create a Marketing Stream

There are two ways to create a Marketing Stream:

  • From scratch: Create a brand new Marketing Stream from the ground up
  • By copying an existing Stream: Copy an existing Marketing Stream to form the base of a new Marketing Stream, then customize it
From scratch Copy an existing Marketing Stream

Follow these steps to create a new Marketing Stream:

  1. In Uberflip, head to the Content page from the sidebar menu
  2. In the Streams tab, click New Stream
  3. The Add a Stream modal will open. Click the Marketing Stream icon in the Curated Streams list

  4. Fill out the details of your Marketing Stream, which includes: 
    • Internal Stream Name (optional)
      A name for your Stream that won't be shown publicly. It's just for you and your team.
    • Stream Page Title (required)
      A title for your Stream that will appear at the top of the Stream page. This will be seen by your prospect.
    • Stream Page Description (optional)
      A brief description of the Stream for your prospect. You can use this field to personalize your Stream and include a brief message to your prospect.
    • Stream Purpose (required)
      Choose a purpose for this Stream. This won't be shown to your prospect.
  5. When ready, click Create 
  6. Your Marketing Stream is now created, and you'll see the Stream editor page. Here you can add content Items to it. Click Add Items to begin

  7. A modal will open. Here you can choose which Items you want to include. All Items in your Hub(s) will be shown. Using the dropdown filters and search field, find and select the Items you want to add. 
  8. When you have selected all the Items you want, click Add
  9. You'll be returned to the Stream view, where the content Items you added will now be shown
    Tip: Content will be displayed in your Stream in the order shown here. To reorder Items, simply drag-and-drop the content tiles into the desired order.
  10. To preview your Stream in a new tab, click Open

Follow these steps to create a new Marketing Stream by copying an existing Marketing Stream. 

When you do this, your new Marketing Stream will be pre-populated with the content from the Stream you copied. From there, you can simply add or remove content to customize it.

  1. In Uberflip, head to the Content page from the sidebar menu
  2. In the Streams tab, find the Marketing Stream you want to copy and click it
  3. In the Stream editor page that opens, click on the three-dot "meatball" menu in the top right. Then click Copy to Another Marketing Stream. 
  4. In the modal that appears, fill out the details of your Stream, just like you would for a new Stream
  5. When ready, click Copy
  6. Your Marketing Stream will be created with all of the Items from the original. From here, add or remove Items and customize the Stream as needed.

That’s it! You're ready to share your new Marketing Stream.

Tip

Want to customize the look and feel of your Stream before sharing it? Check out Personalize a Marketing Stream or Sales Stream to see how. 

Or add Stream sections to organize the content even further.

 

Share a Marketing Stream

When your Marketing Stream is ready to go, all that's left to do is share it. There are two ways to share your stream, with the URL or through social/email sharing.

Direct URL Social & email sharing 

Follow these steps to share the direct URL for the Marketing Stream (ex. in an email). You can also customize this URL, check out Customize and manage your Sales Streams to see how.

  1. In Uberflip, go to your list of Streams (Content > Streams tab) and click the Marketing Stream you want to share
  2. In the Stream editor page, click Open 
  3. While viewing the Sales Stream in your browser, copy the URL from the address bar
  4. You can now paste the URL anywhere you want to share it, and anyone with the URL can view the Stream.

Follow these steps to share your Marketing Stream directly to Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, by email, or using HootSuite with the built-in sharing tool.

  1. In Uberflip, go to your list of Streams (Content > Streams tab) and click on the Stream you want to share
  2. In the Stream editor page, click the meatball menu (three horizontal dots), then click Share

  3. In the modal that appears, click the option you want to use to share the Stream

  4. Depending on your choice, the corresponding app will open, where you can then share the Marketing Stream

articles.name: Hub hack template
articles.title: Hub hack template
articles.body:
Outline what this Hub hack does here.

Important

This Hub Hacks is compatible with **Note Front End V1, V2, or both here** Hubs.

Configure this Hub hack

articles.name: Hub hack: Change the thumbnail for Stream sharing
articles.title: Hub hack: Change the thumbnail for Stream sharing
articles.body:
Use this Custom Code to change the thumbnail of the Share embed tile for your Stream.

Warning

Hub Hacks are not official Uberflip features.

Hub Hacks may not work on all Hubs, or may cause unexpected behavior. If you experience issues with a Hub Hack, available support is limited to helping you disable the Hub Hack only.

Important

This Hub Hacks is only compatible with Front End V2 Hubs.

If you are not sure if your Hub uses Front End V2, see this article for help.

Configure this Hub hack

  1. Add the Custom Code snippet at the bottom of this article to you Hub (see this article to see how it’s done) 
  2. Create a blog Stream to hold hidden Items you’ll create, with the following steps:
    1. Click Content > New Stream > Blog 
    2. Select the Start from Scratch option 
    3. Add a title and description, then click Add your Blog > View Stream
    4. In the Options tab, enable No Robots Meta Tag 
    5. Click the meatball (three horizontal dot) button > Hide Stream
  3. In this blog Stream, go to the Items tab and click the + button to add new Item
  4. Within the blog editor, click the Metadata tab
  5. Add an image URL, or upload the image you want to use as your Share thumbnail
  6. In the Tags tab, add the tag “og-image”
  7. Add the Item you created to the Streams where you want to change the Share thumbnail. Place it as the first Item in the Stream
    Note: Item will be hidden and not shown to your visitors.
  8. Share Stream embed tile, and see new thumbnail you placed on the hidden Item

That’s it!

You can replace the thumbnail image anytime by replacing the image URL in the metadata tab of the blog Item. Note: you may need to clear your cache to see the new thumbnail. 

Code Details

Type: CSS

Placement: Head

Code Snippet: 

 <style data-functionality-name="og-image" >
 .uf-tile-container .uf-item-tile[data-tags*="og-image"]
 {
   display: none !important;
 }
 #collection-items .tile[data-tags*="og-image"]
 {
   display: none !important;
 }
 </style>

articles.name: View a Stream or Item analytics in the Stream/Item editor
articles.title: View a Stream or Item analytics in the Stream/Item editor
articles.body:
Did you know? From within the Stream and Item editor pages of Uberflip, you can view a report on individual Item/Stream performance. This article will show you how.

 

​​Before you begin

  • To see these Uberflip Analytics reports, your Uberflip user account must hold an Uberflip Analytics View license. A View license is automatically granted to any member of the Account Administrator and Analyst user groups. Check out Get started with Uberflip Analytics to learn more. 

 

What is the Item/Stream performance report?

Item and Stream performance reports offer a detailed overview on how an individual Stream or Item is performing across the board. While this information can be found within your Uberflip Analytics, you can also find it in the Stream and Item editor pages for quick review. 

These reports include: Item/Stream details, engagement stats, sessions data, a performance chart, and more. 

 

View your Item/Stream performance report in the editor page

  1. In Uberflip, click Content in the sidebar menu
  2. Select either the Item or Stream tab, depending on the report you want to review 
  3. Find and click the Stream or Item you want to review
  4. At the top of the Item or Stream editor page, select the Item Performance or Stream Performance tab

You’re there! Review your performance report to see how things are going.

articles.name: Announcement: Retiring SnapApp [Aug. 2022]
articles.title: Announcement: Retiring SnapApp [Aug. 2022]
articles.body:
What is happening?

Uberflip is retiring the SnapApp product. 

As of May 1st, 2022, SnapApp will stop receiving updates and maintenance. Users can continue to use the final version until July 31st, 2022, but we suggest using this time to transition to a new tool if needed. 

On August 1st 2022, SnapApp and all related functions will be shut down for all users, and will no longer be available for use. 

 

Why is this happening? 

We’ve loved having SnapApp as part of the Uberflip offering, but marketing tech is always changing. In recent years many users have found new and interesting ways to generate leads using other tools, including Uberflip Stream features and CTAs.

Our desire to innovate and grow our main offering, the Uberflip platform, means making hard decisions on where to allocate resources. This change will allow us to use our time and people to build a better, more powerful Uberflip for the future. 

 

I’m a SnapApp user, what will I do now?

SnapApp’s retirement will mean that all current users need to transition to a different tool to replace SnapApp’s functions. 

If you’re a current SnapApp user and have questions, contact your Uberflip account manager today. They’ll be happy to provide advice and support.

articles.name: Internal: Project Rodimus - Zendesk Workflow for CSAT
articles.title: Internal: Project Rodimus - Zendesk Workflow for CSAT
articles.body:
Objective

When the Project Rodimus team completes a migration, they wish to send the client a satisfaction survey from within Zendesk for reporting purposes. This article outlines the steps needed from ticket creation to completion within Zendesk.

 

Create a New Ticket


Create a new ticket in Zendesk by clicking on the “+ Add” button in the top left of the screen. A new ticket will open




Sidebar Menus


In the sidebar menu perform the following actions:

Requester: Input the client’s email address. If they exist in the Zendesk system, this field will begin auto-populating and you can select the desired user.

If the user doesn't exist, you will need to click the “+ Add User” button from the drop-down. A pop-up window will appear. In the “Name” field, enter the users’ First and Last name. In the “Email” field, enter their email address. Lastly, ensure “End User” is selected from the radio buttons and then click the blue “Add” button.



Assignee: Select this dropdown and choose “Project Rodimus”, then select your user name.

Form: Select this dropdown and choose “Project Rodimus” from the list.

Important Note: A Project Rodimus user must be selected from the Assignee field, and Project Rodimus must be selected from the Form field for the automated, CSAT email to be sent to the customer. These fields are also used for tracking analytics on the Project Rodimus team.

Rodimus Ticket Type: Click this dropdown and select the appropriate ticket type. Either "Migration" or "Migration & Rebrand".

Feature: Select “Hub” then “TV2 Migration” from the dropdown

Enter the appropriate information for the following fields:
Customer Name:
Account ID:
Hub ID:
Hub URL:

Resolution: You must select “Request Implemented” for the CSAT email to be sent. All other options will not work, and the email will not be sent.


Subject & Public Reply

Click the “⚡ Apply Macro” button at the bottom of the page, underneath the Public Reply box. Then select “Project Rodimus” from the dropdown.

The stock, “Subject” and “Public Reply” messaging will appear in the corresponding text boxes.


Submit Case as Solved to Close Case and Send CSAT Survey

In the lower-right hand corner of the screen, select the dropdown arrow beside the “Submit as New” button. A flyout will slide up with a number of options. Choose “Submit as Solved” to close the service request in Zendesk. Once submitted and closed, the CSAT survey will be sent to the associated customer.

articles.name: Feature Items in a Marketing or Source Stream (and your Hub)
articles.title: Feature Items in a Marketing or Source Stream (and your Hub)
articles.body:
In any Source or Marketing Stream, you can feature Items to pin them at the top of your ‘Latest Content’ feed. This article will outline how this functionality works and how to feature Items. 

Good to know

  • Items can be featured in any Source Stream or Marketing Stream (not available in Sales Streams)
  • When ‘Highlight first Item’ in enabled in Hubs labs, The featured Item with the most recent publish date will show up as a 4x sized tile at the top of your Stream/Hub
  • Other featured Items will display in order based on when they were published
  • Featured Items from all Streams will show up at the top of the Hub's ‘Latest Content’ feed
  • Featured Items won’t displace any CTAs on Stream pages or the Hub homepage

Feature Items in a Stream

Follow these steps to feature Items within a Source or Marketing Stream.

  1. Go to the Hub that contains the Item you want to feature
  2. Click Content in the sidebar menu
  3. In the Streams tab, find the Stream containing the Item you want to feature and click on it
  4. Find the Item you want to feature, and click the Star icon at the top of the Item

Featured Items on your Hub's homepage

If you're using the ‘Latest Content’ Stream on your Hub's homepage, featured Items in any Streams will appear at the top of the homepage as well (based on the publish date).

Tip

For more control over the content on your Hub homepage, use a Marketing Stream as your Hub's homepage instead of the ‘Latest Content’ Stream. See how to use a Stream for your Hub's homepage.

articles.name: Hub Hack: Add canonical tags to all Stream level pages
articles.title: Hub Hack: Add canonical tags to all Stream level pages
articles.body:
Objective

Use this Custom Code snippet if you wish to add canonical tags to your Stream pages, which is not possible at the Hub level. Using this Hub hack, the Stream pages will have the canonical tag same as the page URL.

 

Warning

Hub Hacks are not official Uberflip features.

Hub Hacks may not work on all Hubs or may cause unexpected behavior. If you experience issues with a Hub Hack, available support is limited to helping you disable the Hub Hack only.

 

Details

  • Type: JavaScript
  • Placement: Body Bottom
  • Notes: You'll need to choose the appropriate code snippet based on the version of the Uberflip Hub Front End that your Hub is using. If you're not sure which version you are on, see this article for instructions.

 

Code

For Front End V2 Hubs

<script>
// find if it's stream page
const name = document.querySelector('body');
if (name.classList.contains('uf-stream-page') == true) {
updateCanonical();
}

// insert html - canonical URL
function updateCanonical() {
// Insert canonical URL = page url 
const newURL = window.location.href;
document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].innerHTML += `<link rel="canonical" href="${newURL}">`
}
</script>

 

For Front End V1 Hubs

<script>
// find if it's stream page
const name = document.querySelector('body');
if (name.classList.contains('listing-page') == true) {
updateCanonical();
}

// insert html - canonical URL
function updateCanonical() {
// Insert canonical URL = page url
