  1. Select the resource you want to work with, and the bulk action you want to perform on it
  2. Configure and download the corresponding job template
  3. Fill out the job template
  4. Upload the completed job template to Bulk Task Smasher and submit the job for processing

This procedure is the same for all bulk actions that use a job template except the Create Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action, which differs slightly.

You can find detailed instructions for both variations of this procedure below.

Note

Not all bulk actions require a job template: bulk actions that don't use a job template follow a different setup process, which is outlined in the article Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Export and special bulk actions.

 

Set up and run a Create, Update, or Delete bulk action

Warning

Always use this tool with caution.

Bulk Task Smasher can rapidly make extensive changes to your Uberflip account. If you make a mistake, any unwanted changes may be difficult or even impossible to reverse.

To reduce the chances of accidentally making unwanted changes to your Uberflip account, we strongly recommend that you read and use our best practices for using Bulk Task Smasher.

Before you run any bulk action in Bulk Task Smasher, always ensure that you understand exactly what will happen as a result.

Step 1: Select the resource and bulk action

  1. Open Bulk Task Smasher and go to the Run Jobs section of the app.
  2. Use the Resource dropdown menu to choose the type of Uberflip resource you'd like to work with:
  3. Next, use the Action dropdown to choose the type of bulk action (Create, Update, or Delete) that you'd like to perform on the selected resource:
  4. You'll now see a description of the selected resource and action combination:

From here, you can:

  • Download a job template, if you are just starting to set up this bulk action, or
  • Upload a job template, if you have already filled out the job template and are ready to run the bulk action

Step 2: Configure and download the job template

  1. After you have selected the resource and bulk action you want to use, click on Download Job Templates:
  2. You'll now see more information about how this template works, as well as the checkboxes to set up the job template's headers:
  3. Use the checkboxes to choose which of the available column headers will be included in the downloaded file:
    • Bulk Task Smasher will pre-fill the top row of the job template with the headers that you select here. Select (check) a checkbox to include that header in the downloaded template, or deselect (uncheck) a checkbox to remove that column header.
    • Checkboxes that are disabled (greyed out) represent mandatory headers that are required in the job template to perform the selected bulk action, so they can't be removed.
    • All other headers are optional, and you can freely add or remove them depending on what you want to do as part of the bulk action. For example, if you are performing a Create Stream bulk action, check the box for the description header if you want to specify a description for each Stream, or uncheck that box if you don't want to specify Stream descriptions as part of the bulk action.
    • If a header name is marked with an asterisk (e.g. item*), this means that you can add this header to the job template multiple times to specify multiple values (e.g. you can use the item* header multiple times in a Create Stream job template to add multiple Items to the Stream). When you select this type of header, click on the Edit (pencil) icon that appears beside it to specify how many instances of the header you want to add:
    • Use the Select All and Clear buttons to quickly check or uncheck all available optional headers.
  4. Click on the download button to download your template as configured. The options available depend on the type of bulk action you chose:
    • For Create and Delete bulk actions, you can download a Blank Template, which is empty except for the column headers you selected:
    • For Update bulk actions, you choose between either a Blank Template, which is empty, or a Populated Template, which is pre-filled with data from your Uberflip account. For Update bulk actions, the Populated Template is the default option:

  5. The job template file will be downloaded, and you can find it in your Downloads folder.
    • The filenames for all job templates generated by Bulk Task Smasher use the format [Bulk Action] [Template Type] - YYYY-MM-DD HH.MM.SS AM/PM.xlsx, e.g. Update Streams Populated Template - 2022-01-31 12.45.10 PM.xlsx.
    • When you download a Populated Template, Bulk Task Smasher must first gather the data from your Uberflip account to populate the template. If you have a lot of data in your Uberflip account, this process may take a few moments to complete before the download begins.

Step 3: Fill out the job template

Note

Bulk Task Smasher generates job template files as standard Microsoft Excel .XLSX spreadsheet files. This filetype is also compatible with most other common spreadsheet applications, including Google Sheets, Apple Numbers, LibreOffice/OpenOffice Calc, and others.

  1. Open the downloaded job template file in your spreadsheet application of choice.
  2. Fill out the job template as needed:
    • Remember that each line represents a separate instance of the selected Uberflip resource (i.e. each line represents an individual Stream, Item, user, tag, or Flipbook/PDF) to which the selected action (create, update, delete) will be applied:
    • The header above each column indicates the type of information that you must enter in that column on each line. Note that you must enter a value on every line for required headers, but under non-required headers, entering a value on any given line is optional.
    • To erase the existing value for a given property (e.g. description), you must set the value to null (rather than leaving it blank) in the template.
    • To help you, every job template includes a How To Use This Template sheet. Refer to this sheet for explanations of what each header does, what type of data it needs, and whether it is required; as well as example values for each header:

  3. When you're done, save the job template to a location where you'll be able to find it later.

Step 4: Upload the job template and submit the job

  1. Return to Bulk Task Smasher and select the resource and bulk action again (if necessary).
  2. Click on Upload Job Templates:
  3. Click on Upload File, and select the job template file you created.
    • If the file has multiple sheets, the app will prompt you to select the sheet that contains the bulk action instructions you want to use. Use the dropdown to select the sheet, then click on Confirm Sheet:
  4. Bulk Task Smasher will analyze the uploaded file, and will display a preview, as well as any errors it has detected. Check the preview to ensure that you have uploaded the correct file, and to determine if there are any errors that need to be corrected before the file can be processed:
  5. When you have verified that you have uploaded the correct file and that it contains no errors, click on Submit Job. You will see a confirmation window that summarizes the effect of submitting this job, and warns you that once you submit the job, you will NOT be able to stop or undo it:
  6. If you would like to receive an email notification when the job finishes, you can optionally enter an email address into the Recipient Email Address field. Leave this field blank if you do not wish to receive an email (you can check job status at any time from within Bulk Task Smasher).
  7. When you are absolutely sure that you understand what will be changed in your account as a result of running this job, type the word CONFIRM into the field provided, then click on the Confirm Job button to finish submitting the job:
  8. Your job will be submitted to the Bulk Task Smasher queue for processing, and after a moment, you should see a confirmation message that your job has been successfully submitted.
    • The confirmation message contains the job's unique job ID. You can use this ID to quickly find this job while viewing your account's record of submitted jobs:

After you have submitted a job, Bulk Task Smasher will process it. Depending on the size of the job, this may take some time. At any time after submitting a job, you can view the jobs table to check on its status.

 

Set up and run a Create Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action

The Flipbooks/PDFs resource type in Bulk Task Smasher is a special case, because bulk actions involving this resource must use the Uberflip Legacy API. The Legacy API requires a separate login, and does not support the same types of actions as the current Uberflip REST API (which is used by all other Uberflip resources).

As a result, the Flipbooks/PDFs resource only supports Create and Export actions, and the procedure for setting up a Create Flipbooks/PDFs action differs slightly from the other Create actions.

Important

Only the Primary User of an Uberflip account can use the Legacy API, so these bulk actions are only available when you are logged in as the Primary User.

Use this process to set up a Create Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action:

  1. To set up a Create Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action, open Bulk Task Smasher and go to the Run Jobs section.
  2. Use the Resources dropdown to select "Flipbooks/PDFs".
  3. Although Bulk Task Smasher can obtain your Uberflip REST API credentials automatically, it is not able to do so for your Legacy API credentials. As a result, you'll need to enter your Legacy API credentials to proceed. If you do not know your Legacy API credentials, click on the link provided to view them (and generate them if needed):
  4. After entering your Legacy API credentials, click on Validate and Save Credentials.
    • The credentials you have entered will be saved for the rest of your session, so you won't need to enter them again if you run multiple Flipbooks/PDFs bulk actions.
  5. Now, use the Actions dropdown to select Create Flipbooks/PDFs.
  6. Click on the Download Job Templates button, then download, open, and fill out the job template in the same way as any other bulk action that uses job templates.
    • See the section Set up and run a Create, Update, or Delete bulk action for detailed instructions on how to fill out out a job template.
  7. After you have completed the job template, return to Bulk Task Smasher and select Flipbooks/PDFs > Create Flipbooks/PDFs again (if needed). Then, click on the Upload Job Templates button.
  8. From here, simply upload the job template file and submit thejob as you would with any other bulk action that requires a job template:

After you have submitted a job, Bulk Task Smasher will process it. Depending on the size of the job, this may take some time. At any time after submitting a job, you can view the jobs table to check on its status.

 

Notes

Some clarification on the behavior of the Delete bulk actions:

  • For Streams and Items, the Delete actions will archive the specified Streams and Items, rather than permanently deleting them. This means that Streams and Items deleted with Bulk Task Smasher can still be recovered in most cases (just like Streams and Items deleted through the Uberflip application).
  • For Streams, the special actions labeled as Remove will not archive (or delete) Items, but only remove them from the specified Marketing and/or Sales Streams, while still keeping them in their respective Source Streams (as well as any other Marketing and/or Sales Streams not specified as part of the action).
  • For tags and users, the Delete actions (including the special actions like Delete All Unused Tags) will permanently delete the specified tags or users. Tags and users deleted with Bulk Task Smasher can not be recovered (just like tags and users deleted through the Uberflip application).

articles.name: Hub Hack: Add a YouTube live stream and chat to an Uberflip Stream
articles.title: Hub Hack: Add a YouTube live stream and chat to an Uberflip Stream
articles.body:
Want to host a YouTube live stream within an Uberflip Stream, complete with live video and the chat? With this Custom Code, you can do just that. 

Warning

Hub Hacks are not official Uberflip features.

Hub Hacks may not work on all Hubs, or may cause unexpected behavior. If you experience issues with a Hub Hack, available support is limited to helping you disable the Hub Hack only.

Important

This Hub Hack is only compatible with Front End V2 Hubs.

Not sure if your Hub uses Front End V2? See this article for help.

 

Before you begin

  • You’ll need to have a YouTube integration set up to use this Hub Hack
  • To add Custom Code, you need to be an Uberflip Account Admin or Content Manager

 

Add a YouTube live stream and chat to an Uberflip Stream

Tip

If you want to add live stream video without chat, only complete step one.

  1. Add a YouTube live stream (scheduled, live, or uploaded) to an Uberflip Stream exactly as you would any other YouTube video
    • Check out Set Up a YouTube Integration to see how.
  2. In the Uberflip sidebar menu, select Hub Options > Advanced, and check the box that says Include Item tags for Custom Code
    • This setting will auto-save once clicked.
  3. Add the Custom Code (found at the bottom of this article) to your Hub
    • See the full Custom Code guide here. 
  4. In Uberflip, tag the YouTube live stream Item with the tag: itemType.youtubeLive
    Note: Tag must be written exactly as shown. 

That’s it! Your YouTube live stream (with chat) can now be used in your Marketing and Sales Streams in Uberflip.

 

Code details

Type: Javascript

Placement: Below Footer

Code Snippet:

<!-- Youtube Live App //-->
<script>
(function($, Hubs, undefined) {
/* run only in the right scenario */
if(
typeof Hubs.appInstance.pageType !== 'undefined' &&
Hubs.appInstance.pageType ==='item' &&
( Hubs.Config.externalService === 'youtube' || Hubs.appInstance.itemType == 'youtube' || $('body').hasClass('uf-page-type-youtube') ) &&
Hubs.appInstance.currentItemTags !== undefined &&
Hubs.appInstance.currentItemTags.indexOf( 'itemType.youtubeLive' ) >= 0
){
var url_base = 'https://flipbot.uberflip.com/';
if(Hubs.appInstance.queryString.env){
url_base = Hubs.appInstance.queryString.env === 'stage' ? 'https://uf-flipbot-stage.herokuapp.com/' : 'http://localhost/flipbot/';
}
$.when( $.getScript(url_base + 'plugins/youtube-live/uf-youtube-live.min.js' ) ).done(function() {
ufYoutubeLive.init({debug: true});
});
}
}(window.jQuery, window.Hubs));
</script>

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: Best practices for use
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: Best practices for use
articles.body:
When using Bulk Task Smasher, follow these best practices to help mitigate the risk of accidentally making unwanted changes to your Uberflip account.

 

Best practice 1: Set up permissions

Bulk Task Smasher comes with a permissions system that you can use to control who can access the app, and even which functionality within the app they have access to. We recommend setting up your permissions so that:

  • Access to the app is restricted to only trusted users
  • Users who have access to the app can only use the capabilities they need and have been trained on

For more details about setting up Bulk Task Smasher's permissions, see Bulk Task Smasher: Configure permissions to control access to app features.

 

Best practice 2: Always do a test run first

Before running any size of job in Bulk Task Smasher, always do a test run involving just a few instances of the target resource first.

For example, say you want to update five hundred Items. First, run the exact same job on just five of the Items, then check that those five test Items were updated as expected before proceeding. This gives you the opportunity to find and fix any issues with your job template before they can impact hundreds of Items.

 

Best practice 3: Double-check your job templates

After building your job template, always run through it to again to check for problems before you upload it to Bulk Task Smasher (ideally, have a second person review the job template to catch anything you might have missed).

Likewise, double-check the file name when selecting the job template file you're uploading to Bulk Task Smasher: since the file names of different job template files can be very similar, it's easy to pick the wrong one by mistake.

As a final check, use the preview that appears in Bulk Task Smasher after uploading a file to verify that you have the correct file, and that the data it contains is correct.

 

Best practice 4: Run an Export action before running any Update action

Mistakes made with the Update bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher can be the most devastating: these actions affect the existing resources in your Uberflip account, and there is no "undo" button to reverse them.

However, you can (and should) set yourself up with a backup plan for Update actions by always running a corresponding Export action first. For example, if you want to update a number of Streams with the Update Streams action, you should first run the Export Streams action. The export file will contain a record of the state of your account before you ran the Update action, which gives you a way to recover to that state in case there is a problem with the outcome of the Update action.

Make sure to keep the "backup" export file in a safe place, and don't delete it until you're sure that the Update action had the desired results!

 

Best practice 5: Only include essential headers and remove all unchanged data when using Populated Templates

When you run an Update bulk action in Bulk Task Smasher, you have the option of downloading a Populated Template, which is pre-populated with relevant data from your Uberflip account. This makes it easy to make changes, since you can just edit the existing data, rather than having to re-enter it.

Whenever you use a Populated Template as the basis for your job template, you should always:

  • Select only headers for data you want to update when configuring the Populated Template download. For example, if you want to run an Update Items action to update various Item descriptions, select the header for description when configuring the job template download, but do not select headers for data you don't want to update, such as title, author_id, canonical_url, etc.
  • Remove any pre-populated data from the job template that you did not change before you upload the file to Bulk Task Smasher. Make sure to remove any data that was pre-populated in the job template if you did not make any changes to that data. In the previous example, if you edited the descriptions for Item 1, Item 2, and Item 3, but not for Item 5 and Item 6, remove the lines representing Item 5 and Item 6 from the job template.

The reason for these practices is that Bulk Task Smasher will process everything that's included in a job template — even if there is no difference from what already exists in the account. 

Since Populated Templates will include pre-populated data for all the headers you select for every instance of the respective resource (e.g. for every Stream, every Item, etc.), all of this data will be used to update the corresponding fields, settings, etc. in Uberflip, even if there is no "real" change to be made.

For most types of resources, the primary negative effect of this is that it slows down the processing of your bulk action (as Bulk Task Smasher still has to process all of the unnecessary updates). For Items specifically, there is an additional, potentially unwanted side effect: "updates" where no actual change is made will still change the published date of the Item. As a result, it's always best to exclude/remove any unchanged data when using a Populated Template.

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: Configure permissions to control access to app features
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: Configure permissions to control access to app features
articles.body:
Learn how to configure Bulk Task Smasher user permissions to determine which app features your users can access.

 

Before you begin

  • To configure app permissions, you need to be a member of the Account Administrators or Content Managers user groups.
  • To configure these settings, the Bulk Task Smasher Marketplace app must be installed in your Hub.

 

About Bulk Task Smasher permissions

Bulk Task Smasher is a very powerful tool, and can rapidly make extensive changes to an Uberflip account that may be difficult (or even impossible) to reverse. As a result, we strongly recommend that you restrict access to Bulk Task Smasher within your organization to only trusted users who understand how the tool works and how to use it.

To help you do that, Bulk Task Smasher hooks into Uberflip's permissions system, and features app-specific permissions which you can configure to control access to the app itself, as well as to specific functions (bulk actions) within the app.

 

How Bulk Task Smasher permissions work

When you install the Bulk Task Smasher Marketplace app in your Uberflip account, the app will:

  • Create a set of permissions in your account, each of which controls access to specific functionality in the Bulk Task Smasher app
  • Grant the available permissions to the Account Administrators user group by default

Below is a breakdown of the permissions Bulk Task Smasher creates, along with the functionality the permission controls:

Permission

Allows the user to...
Bulk Task Smasher Access the app (by making the "Bulk Task Smasher" option in the Uberflip sidebar menu visible) as well as Export bulk actions for all available resources in the app
Create Operators Access Create bulk actions for all available resources in the app
Update Operators Access Update bulk actions for all available resources in the app
Delete Operators Access Delete bulk actions for all available resources in the app

 

Configure Bulk Task Smasher permissions

By default, all members of the Account Administrators user group are granted all available Bulk Task Smasher permissions.

If you want to use non-default user groups with Bulk Task Smasher, or if you want to restrict access to certain functions, you can configure Bulk Task Smasher's permissions by either granting or revoking permissions as needed. As with all Uberflip permissions, you can grant or revoke permissions at either the user group level (which affects all users within the user group), or at the individual user level (which affects only that user, unless they are also a member of a user group that grants the permissions).

  1. To configure permissions for Bulk Task Smasher, log in to the Uberflip backend (app.uberflip.com).
  2. In the top right, click on your name, then click on Account Settings:
  3. In the sidebar menu, click on Organization. Then, click on:
    • Users if you want to configure permissions for specific users only.
    • Groups if you want to configure permissions for all members of a user group.
  4. Next, click on the user or user group (depending on your choice in the previous step) for which you want to modify permissions.
  5. While viewing the user or user group, click on the Permissions tab.
  6. Scroll to the bottom of the list of permissions, where you should see a Bulk Task Smasher section:
  7. Here, simply grant or revoke permissions as required:
    • To give access to a feature for the selected user/user group, check the box beside the corresponding permission to grant it.
    • To remove access to a feature for the selected user/user group, uncheck the box beside the corresponding permission to revoke it.
  8. Your changes will be saved automatically, and will take effect immediately.

Important

If you grant any of the available child permissions (Create/Update/Delete Operators), you must also grant the parent Bulk Task Smasher permission. If you do not do this, the child permissions will have no effect, as users who do not have the parent permission will not be able to access the app.

articles.name: Update Uberflip Marketplace apps
articles.title: Update Uberflip Marketplace apps
articles.body:
Learn how you can update apps that you have installed from the Uberflip Marketplace to ensure you're on the latest version.

 

Before you begin

  • To get updates for Marketplace apps installed on your organization's Uberflip account, you need to be an Account Admin or Content Manager.

 

About Uberflip Marketplace app updates

Just like the main Uberflip platform, apps you install from the Uberflip Marketplace will be routinely updated with new features, enhancements, and bug fixes. We recommend that you always install the latest updates for your installed apps whenever they're available so you can take advantage of the latest features

At this time, the Uberflip Marketplace does not (yet) support auto-updating of apps or notifications of pending updates. As a result, you'll need to periodically check for updates and manually install any available updates to your apps. This article describes how you can do that.

 

Check for and install Marketplace app updates

Follow these steps to check if any updates are available for your installed apps, and to install any updates that are available.

  1. Log in to your Uberflip account.
  2. In the menu bar at the top, hover your mouse over Marketplace.
  3. In the sub-menu that appears, click on Browse Apps:
  4. This will open the Uberflip Marketplace. Click on Installed Apps:
  5. You'll see a list of apps that are currently installed in your Uberflip account. Click on any app in the list to see if there are updates available for that app:
  6. This will open the app's listing page. If an update is available for the selected app, you'll see an Update button:
  7. Click on Update, then click on Update in the confirmation window to install the updated version of the app in your Uberflip account:
  8. That's it! The update should now be installed.
  9. You can confirm that the update was installed by checking the app's listing page. If there is no Update button and you only see an Uninstall button, the latest version is installed and no updates are currently available for the app:

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: Stream Purpose ID codes
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: Stream Purpose ID codes
articles.body:
A reference guide to the Stream Purpose ID codes that must be used when setting the Stream Purpose for a Stream in Bulk Task Smasher.

 

Before you begin

  • This article describes the special ID codes to use when setting a Stream Purpose on a Stream with Bulk Task Smasher's Streams > Create Streams and Streams > Update Streams bulk actions. For instructions on how to use these bulk actions, or the Bulk Task Smasher app in general, see the user guide.

 

Reference: Stream Purpose ID codes

When creating or updating a Stream using Bulk Task Smasher, you can also (optionally) set or change the Stream Purpose for that Stream, just as you can in Uberflip:

If you would like to set a Stream Purpose using Bulk Task Smasher, the Uberflip API (which Bulk Task Smasher uses to interact with your Uberflip account) requires that you specify the desired Stream Purpose using numeric Stream Purpose ID codes.

Each available Stream Purpose setting has a corresponding Stream Purpose code, and these are outlined in the table below:

Stream Purpose setting Stream Purpose code

Account-Based Marketing

1

Demand Generation

4

Inbound Marketing

7

Sales Engagement

10

Customer Engagement

13

Internal

16

Other

19

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: User Guide
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: User Guide
articles.body:
Use the Bulk Task Smasher app to automate repetitive manual actions with just a spreadsheet and a few clicks of your mouse.

 

Before you begin

  • To use Bulk Task Smasher, your Uberflip account must have API access. This feature is included with certain pack types, or may be added on to your Uberflip subscription. For more information, please speak with your Uberflip account representative.
  • To follow the instructions in this article, you must be a member of the Account Administrators user group in the Uberflip account where you are using Bulk Task Smasher.
    • After installing the Bulk Task Smasher Marketplace app, you can also configure app permissions to give any user or user group access to the Bulk Task Smasher app, as well as to control access to particular bulk action categories within the app. For details, see this article.

 

About Bulk Task Smasher

What is Bulk Task Smasher?

Bulk Task Smasher is an app that helps you to efficiently complete high-volume tasks in Uberflip. It works by automating repetitive and time-consuming manual actions for tasks like creating users, managing Streams, adding tags, and more.

Rather than having to repeat the same manual actions over and over, Bulk Task Smasher lets you simply set up a spreadsheet with the details of the tasks you need to complete, then takes that spreadsheet and performs the actual tasks for you automatically.

What can Bulk Task Smasher do?

Bulk Task Smasher can automate a variety of bulk tasks for your Uberflip Streams, Items, users and tags:

  • For each of these resources, Bulk Task Smasher can perform general bulk actions like create, update, export, and delete. These allow you to efficiently do things like create a large number of Streams, update many users, export all of your Items, or delete many tags at once.
  • Certain resources also have special bulk actions available that are fully automated, such as "delete all unused tags", or "hide all Items older than a certain date".
  • Bulk Task Smasher also has limited support for Flipbooks/PDFs, allowing you to easily upload document files in bulk.

Here is an overview of all of the bulk actions that Bulk Task Smasher can perform (expand sections to view):

Streams
Action Allows you to...
Create Streams Create new Streams of any type and configure key details (name, description, etc.), as well as basic Stream options, plus add Items and Multi-Language Links
Export Streams Export a spreadsheet with details of all existing Streams, as well as optional additional data about Items, Stream options, and Multi-Language Links
Update Streams Modify the details of specified Streams as well as basic Stream options, plus add Items and manage Multi-Language Links

Delete Streams

 Delete (archive) specified Streams
Update Stream Options Modify additional Stream options for specified Streams

Remove Items from Marketing/Sales Streams

 Remove all Items from specified Marketing and Sales Streams
Remove Hidden Items from Marketing/Sales Streams Remove only hidden Items from specified Marketing and Sales Streams
Remove Secondary URLs from Streams Remove previous/secondary URL paths from Streams
Items
Action Allows you to...
Create Items Create new Blog Items in specified Blog Streams and configure key details (author, title, content, etc.), plus add tags and Multi-Language Links

Export Items

 Export a spreadsheet with details of all existing Items, as well as optional additional data about attached tags, Streams, and Multi-Language Links
Update Items Modify the details of specified Items of any type, plus manage tags and Multi-Language Links
Delete Items Delete (archive) specified Items
Create Item-Level Custom Code Blocks Create and configure Item-Level Custom Code blocks on specified Items
Export Item-Level Custom Code Blocks Export a spreadsheet with details of all existing Item-Level Custom Code blocks
Update Item-Level Custom Code Blocks Modify the details of specified Item-Level Custom Code blocks
Delete Item-Level Custom Code Blocks Delete specified Item-Level Custom Code blocks
Hide/Show Items Older Than Date Automatically find all Items created before a specified date and hide them
Delete Items Older Than Date Automatically find all Items created before a specified date and delete (archive) them
Remove Secondary URLs from Items Remove previous/secondary URL paths from Items
Users
Action Allows you to...
Create Users Create new users and configure their details (name, email, bio, etc.) as well as optionally assign them to existing user groups
Export Users Export a spreadsheet with details of all current users, as well as optional additional data about the user groups they belong to
Update Users Modify the details of specified users, including the user groups they belong to
Delete Users Delete specified users
Tags
Action Allows you to...
Create Tags Create new tags
Export Tags Export a spreadsheet containing a list of all existing tags
Update Tags Modify the details of specified existing tags
Delete Tags Delete a specified set of tags
Delete All Tags Automatically delete all tags
Delete Unused Tags Automatically find all tags that are currently not attached to any Items and delete them
Flipbooks/PDFs
Action Allows you to...
Create Flipbooks/PDFs Download PDF files from specified URLs, then upload them to specified Folders to create corresponding Flipbooks (or PDFs)

How does Bulk Task Smasher work?

To set up most bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher, you fill out a job template. A job template is simply a specially formatted spreadsheet where you enter instructions for the actions you want the tool to perform.

Job templates are specific to bulk actions, and you can download the necessary job template for each bulk action directly within the app.  Like all spreadsheets, job templates consist of columns and rows:

  • Running across the top of the job template are the preset column headers. These specify the type of information that you enter into that column to configure each step of the bulk action. Every job template has at least one required header, and most also have a number of optional headers that you can configure to your needs when you download the job template.
  • After the first row (which contains the column headers), every other row in the job template represents a distinct step in the bulk action: for example, if you're creating Streams, each row represents a different Stream to be created.

For example, say you want to add a group of new users to your Uberflip account: to do this, you set up a job template where each row represents a user you want to create. On every row, you fill out the columns with the necessary details to create each user, such as their first name, last name, email, etc.:

Once your job template is ready, you simply upload it to Bulk Task Smasher. The tool then runs through every row in the job template, and automatically performs each required action as specified.

Info

Not all bulk actions require a job template: some special bulk actions are configured directly within the Bulk Task Smasher app, and therefore do not require a job template to be run.

 

Install Bulk Task Smasher

To use Bulk Task Smasher, you must first install the Bulk Task Smasher Marketplace app.

  1. Log in to your Uberflip account at app.uberflip.com.
  2. Head to the Bulk Task Smasher in Marketplace.
  3. Click on Install.
  4. If the app has been successfully installed, you'll see Bulk Task Smasher listed under Marketplace > Installed Apps in Uberflip:
  5. In addition, you'll also see a new Bulk Task Smasher menu option in the sidebar menu in Uberflip:

 

Open Bulk Task Smasher

To use Bulk Task Smasher to set up and run bulk actions, begin by opening the app from within Uberflip.

  1. Log in to your Uberflip account at app.uberflip.com.
  2. Click on Bulk Task Smasher in the sidebar menu:
  3. You will be logged in to Bulk Task Smasher automatically, and the Bulk Task Smasher app interface will appear on the right:

From here, you can set up and run bulk actions.

Info

Bulk Task Smasher accesses your account using your Uberflip API credentials. If you have not yet generated API credentials for your user account, Bulk Task Smasher will automatically generate these for you the first time you open the app.

 

Set up and run bulk actions with Bulk Task Smasher

Warning

Always use this tool with caution.

Bulk Task Smasher can rapidly make extensive changes to your Uberflip account. If you make a mistake, any unwanted changes may be difficult or even impossible to reverse.

To reduce the chances of accidentally making unwanted changes to your Uberflip account, we strongly recommend that you read and use our best practices for using Bulk Task Smasher.

Before you run any bulk action in Bulk Task Smasher, always ensure that you understand exactly what will happen as a result.

In Bulk Task Smasher, you begin setting up all available bulk actions the same way:

  1. First, select the type of Uberflip resource (Streams, Items, tags, users, or Flipbooks/PDFs) that you want to apply a bulk action to:

  2. Then, choose from a list of available bulk actions for that resource:

From this point, the specific steps for setting up and running the bulk action vary depending on the type of bulk action you selected:

For instructions on setting up the Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions for any resource, see this article:

Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions

For instructions on setting up the Export bulk actions for any resource, as well as the special bulk actions that are available for certain resources, see this article:

Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Export and special bulk actions

 

Check on the status of submitted jobs

After you set up and submit a bulk action (or "job") in Bulk Task Smasher, the app will process the job and automatically perform the necessary tasks to complete the bulk action you set up.

All Bulk Task Smasher jobs submitted in your account are recorded in the jobs table, where you can check on the status of any job (whether it has been completed, and if so, if it completed successfully or with errors), as well as view details of all past jobs.

Note

Export bulk actions are not recorded in the jobs table, because they are not submitted and processed like other bulk actions.

The jobs table displays the current status of all current and past jobs at a glance. The possible statuses are:

Processing
The job is still being processed by Bulk Task Smasher, and is not yet complete.
Completed
Bulk Task Smasher has completed the job, and was able to perform all steps in the job without errors.
Warning
Bulk Task Smasher has completed the job, but some steps could not be performed (typically due to errors in the job template).
Failed
Bulk Task Smasher encountered a critical error and was not able to complete the job.
  1. To view the jobs table at any time, click on View Jobs:

  2. This will display the jobs table, which lists all jobs submitted in your account:
  3. Click on the table entry of any completed job to view more information about that job. In this expanded view, you can review a detailed log of all the actions Bulk Task Smasher performed. Use the filter controls to view either all log entries for the job, only errors, or only fatal errors:
  4. In this view, you can also download the original job template file that was used to submit the job, as well as export a full log of actions performed as part of the job:
  5. Lastly, you can also use the search box to search for any job by its job ID (which is provided in the confirmation message whenever you submit a job), and export the complete jobs table:

 

Notes

  • The error messages shown in the job logs are provided by the Uberflip API, and are not modified by Bulk Task Smasher in any way. As these error messages were intended for API users (i.e. developers), they can often be difficult to interpret for a non-technical user. Here are some common error messages you might encounter, and what they typically mean:

    • Resource not found: Bulk Task Smasher couldn't perform the specified action on the specified resource (e.g. a specific Stream, Item, user, tag, or Flipbook/PDF), because it could not find that resource in the Uberflip account. This usually happens because the resource's identifier code (i.e. a Stream ID, Item ID, etc.) was entered incorrectly in the job template, or because the resource simply does not exist (or no longer exists) in the account. To resolve, check the provided ID(s) for the affected resource(s) and correct them as needed.

    • Delete blocked by dependencies: Bulk Task Smasher couldn't delete the specified resource, because other resources in the Uberflip account require this resource to exist and blocked the deletion. To resolve, check the error message for details of the resource that blocked the deletion, and delete it first if applicable.

articles.name: Internal: Offboarding Customer Content from Uberflip
articles.title: Internal: Offboarding Customer Content from Uberflip
articles.body:
Objective

A guide for the CSM through the off-boarding process for a client. This isn't intended to be shared with clients.

 

To-Do List

  1. Provide a Hub Content Export (including item body content in HTML format) to show all URLs
  2. Set up URL redirects for the Hub pages at the server-side and not in the Hub itself, as the Uberflip URLs and redirects will be lost once the Hub is deactivated
  3. For redirects, there are two routes
    • Decouple the domain from your hub and point it to wherever the new destination is (when you are ready to completely migrate off)
    • Use an alternative means of verifying your ownership of the domain (e.g. email). Once Uberflip is deactivated, the content is no longer there, so no redirects can be implemented on our end and must be on the client-side. One option is to send traffic to a page that says, "This content no longer exists here. It has been moved to url.com (or wherever it lives)."
  4. DNS - Be ready to switch your subdomains to the appropriate locations for the new URLs (This has to be done on the CMS/DNS side of things)
  5. If on a subdomain, they can remove the CNAME record in their DNS that is pointing that domain to read.uberflip.com
  6. Download all flipbooks from the account, unless they already have the original versions stored elsewhere, and if they do not have the most updated copies and then upload them where they need to be. You can download the flipbooks by using the hub hack
  7. If they blogged in Uberflip and not on their CMS, and want a backup of that, save the RSS for the Blog Source Stream. There are two options for migrating them:
    • To successfully pull the blog content, go to your content page and click into each individual blog stream and click "RSS". You can then access the feed and if there is a way to ingest RSS feeds in the target location of the content, you can do it that way
    • Copy and paste each one. If you're doing this I'd pick and choose the best performers
  8. If any content from this Hub has been embedded on external web pages, those should be removed
  9. If required, get a JSON Export of Uberflip Analytics and can use it for future reference (this will need to be requested to the Engineering team)
  10. Download all images if they don’t have a file saved.
  11. In your CMS - Add and create any 301s that are required
  12. Export the 301's lists from the Hub.
  13. Have your New URLs/webpages ready to go
  14. Perform a metrics export on their content if they require that

articles.name: Set Up ZoomInfo FormComplete on Form CTAs
articles.title: Set Up ZoomInfo FormComplete on Form CTAs
articles.body:
Integrating ZoomInfo FormComplete with your Hub Form CTAs will make it easier for prospects to fill out your forms. Simply ask for an email address and then let ZoomInfo do the rest. This integration will allow you to only show fields with unknown data on a prospect, increasing the chance for form conversions. Reduce friction as field data already known by ZoomInfo based on email address will not be shown and submitted in the background.

 

Before you begin

  • To create this integration, you need to be an Account Admin or Content Manager.
  • Have access to ZoomInfo and FormComplete functionality.
  • Hub is on the Front End V2 framework. See this article to determine which version your Hub uses.

 

Step 1: Create a New Form in ZoomInfo

  1. Go to https://login.zoominfo.com/ and log in to your account.
  2. Access the FormComplete section of the app.
  3. Follow these steps outlined by ZoomInfo, starting at the Create a New Form (Manual Mode) section. When creating your form, it should look something like this:

  4. Set up the form as shown above. This example is if you are using Email, First Name, Last Name, and Company Name on your form. You can add fields as needed based on your requirements. Where your form setup might differ is highlighted in red:
    1. The Whitelist Domains section should include the domains of the Hub(s) you are installing this on (Eg. hub1.acme.com and hub2.acme.com)
    2. The input data-mapping values will be dependant on the API names in your MAP (Eg. the field First Name has an API name of firstName).
  5. Once the form setup is complete, select Save & Install and copy the HTML snippet ZoomInfo provides. It should look something like this:

 

Step 2: Add the ZoomInfo Code to Your Hub

  1. Log in to Uberflip.
  2. Go to Hubs > Appearance > Custom Code.

  3. Click on the +Add Code button.

  4. The Add New Code window will appear. Begin by typing in a name and (optionally) description for this piece of custom code (e.g. "ZoomInfo Integration"). Then, click on the Add Code button.
  5. This will take you to the Edit Custom Code view. Scroll down and click on the Code tab.
  6. Under Placement, use the dropdown to choose Head (it may already be selected by default).
  7. In the code field underneath, paste in the following code: 
    <style>
    div[data-zi-mapped-form] div:not(.uf-email-field) {
    display: none;
    }
    div[data-zi-mapped-form] div[data-zi-field-enriched="false"],
    div[data-zi-mapped-form] div[data-zi-field-enriched="false"] .control,
    div[data-zi-mapped-form] div.uf-email-field .control{
    display: block !important;
    }
    div[data-zi-mapped-form] div[data-zi-field-enriched="true"] {
    display: none !important;
    }
    </style>
    <script>
    window.addEventListener('uberflip.ctaActivate', () => {
    (function () {
    window._zi = { formId: '[YOUR FORM ID]', formLoadTimeout: 4000 };
    var zi = document.createElement('script');
    zi.type = 'text/javascript';
    zi.async = true;
    zi.src = 'https://ws-assets.zoominfo.com/formcomplete.js';
    var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
    s.parentNode.insertBefore(zi, s);
    })();
    });
    </script>
  8. In the code snippet, replace the section [YOUR FORM ID] with the ID from the snippet you saved from ZoomInfo in Step 1.
  9. Click on the Save button below the code field.
  10. Lastly, scroll back up and switch the toggle under Enable Custom Code to the on (green) position.

And that's it — you've successfully integrated ZoomInfo FormComplete with your Hub Form CTAs!

 

Examples: See it in Action

  1. Full Match: Email is typed in. First Name, Last Name and Company Name are all known, therefore none are shown and instead submitted in the background when the form is completed.
  2. Partial Match: Email is typed in. First Name and Company Name are known, but Last Name isn't known, therefore only Last Name is prompted. The remaining fields aren't shown and submitted in the background.
  3. No Match: Email is typed in. First Name, Last Name and Company Name are all unknown, therefore the visitor is prompted to fill them out.

articles.name: Internal: Use Bulk Task Smasher to create or update Redirect Rules and Smart Filters
articles.title: Internal: Use Bulk Task Smasher to create or update Redirect Rules and Smart Filters
articles.body:
Objective

Bulk Task Smasher can be used to perform bulk actions on Redirect Rules and Smart Filters. However, because the Uberflip API has complex requirements for creating or updating these resources, it is very difficult to build the necessary Bulk Task Smasher job template by hand.

To more easily set up job templates to create or update Redirect Rules and Smart Filters with Bulk Task Smasher, follow the process described in this article.

Info

Bulk actions related to Redirect Rules and Smart Filters are available exclusively in the internal version of Bulk Task Smasher, and can only be accessed by Uberflip employees.

Customers who install the public Bulk Task Smasher app do not have access to these actions. As a result, if a customer wants to use the app to perform bulk actions on Redirect Rules and Smart Filters, this must be done by an Uberflip employee on the customer's behalf.

 

Background

As with all Bulk Task Smasher create/update actions, creating or updating Redirect Rules or Smart Filters in bulk requires a valid job template, which is a file containing values that define how the desired Redirect Rules or Smart Filters should work.

However, job templates for Redirect Rules and Smart Filters both require values that must follow very complex syntax rules to be accepted by the Uberflip API. For example, take a Smart Filter with the following search criteria:

  • Located in: Example Hub: Any visible Stream
    AND
  • Item status: Hidden

To create the same search criteria through Bulk Task Smasher, the Uberflip API requires the following value:

{"and_or":{"excludes_streams":"false","excludes_tags":"false","excludes_text":"false","includes_streams":"false","includes_tags":"false","includes_text":"false"},"includes_streams":{"all_non_hidden_streams":"Any visible Stream"},"item_status":{"hidden":"Hidden"}}

Because it would be very difficult and time-consuming to understand and follow these rules to create the necessary values by hand, we recommend an alternate method: create the desired Redirect Rules/Smart Filters in Uberflip, so that you can use them as a model for any additional rules you want to create or update in bulk.

 

Step 1: Create the "model" Redirect Rule(s) or Smart Filter(s)

Before setting up your job template, begin by using Uberflip to create your "model" Redirect Rules and/or Smart Filters. Once created, you will be able to simply copy these into your job templates to create as many Redirect Rules/Smart Filters with the same structure/functionality as needed.

  1. Log in to the Uberflip admin backend and access the Uberflip account you're working with (i.e. the customer account, if you are setting up a bulk action for a customer).
  2. Navigate to the Redirect Rules or Smart Filters section of the platform, depending on the kind of resource you want to create/update in bulk.
  3. Create a new Redirect Rule or Smart Filter and configure it in the same way as the Redirect Rules/Smart Filters you want to create or update in bulk.
    • Repeat this step as needed to create additional template Redirect Rules/Smart Filters.
  4. When you have created the necessary model Redirect Rule(s)/Smart Filter(s), move to the next step.

 

Step 2: Download a Populated Template to get job template values

To get the correct syntax for your Redirect Rules or Smart Filters job template, just download a Populated Template: this will contain the correct values for your "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters, which you can then simply copy to create the job template.

  1. Log in to Bulk Task Smasher using the API credentials of the Uberflip account (customer account) you're working with.
  2. In the Run Jobs section, use the dropddowns to navigate to 
  3. Redirect Rules > Update Redirect Rules or Smart Filters > Update Smart Filters (depending on the type of resource you want to work with).
  4. Click on Download Job Templates, ensure all headers are selected, then click on Download Populated Template.
  5. Open the downloaded job template in Excel (or another spreadsheet program).
  6. In the job template, locate the rows representing the "model" Redirect Rule(s)/Smart Filter(s) you created, then move to the next step.

 

Step 3: Build the job template to create Redirect Rules or Smart Filters

Now that you have the right syntax for a Redirect Rules or Smart Filters job template, you're ready to build it. For both Create and Update bulk actions, you will use the Populated Template you downloaded in the previous step as the base.

For a Create bulk action

If you want to run a Create Redirect Rules or Create Smart Filters bulk action:

  1. In the Populated Template, delete the filter_id column from the spreadsheet.
  2. In the Populated Template, delete all populated rows from the spreadsheet except those representing your "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters.
  3. Copy and paste the "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters rows as many times as necessary to create additional Redirect Rules/Smart Filters with the same structure.
    • You can also copy and paste only cells/columns as needed.
  4. Change any values as required, then run the job template in Bulk Task Smasher to create the Redirect Rules or Smart Filters as specified.

For an Update bulk action

If you want to run an Update Redirect Rules or Update Smart Filters bulk action:

  1. In the Populated Template, delete any rows representing Redirect or Smart Filters that you do NOT want to update from the spreadsheet.
  2. Copy values as needed from the "model" Redirect Rules/Smart Filters rows and then paste those values into rows representing the Redirect Rules/Smart Filters that you want to update.
  3. Change any other values as required (remember to leave all identifying values, e.g. redirect_id, filter_id, hub_id, etc. unchanged), then run the job template in Bulk Task Smasher to update the Redirect Rules or Smart Filters as specified.

articles.name: Internal: What is Uberflip's Recovery Time Objective (RTO)?
articles.title: Internal: What is Uberflip's Recovery Time Objective (RTO)?
articles.body:
Question

What is Uberflip's Recovery Time Objective (RTO)?

 

Answer

Uberflip has been designed with resiliency using AWS Availability Zones to mitigate most infrastructure issues.  In the event of a complete disaster where an entire Amazon Region becomes unavailable, Uberflip may take up to a week to restore service.

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: What does the warning about the Excel character limit mean?
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: What does the warning about the Excel character limit mean?
articles.body:
Question

I am trying to download a file from Bulk Task Smasher, and the app is telling me there is some problem with Excel and a character limit. What does this mean?

 

Answer

Background

Bulk Task Smasher can generate two kinds of files that incorporate data from your Uberflip account: Populated Templates and Exports. The generated files are Microsoft Excel spreadsheets in the .XLSX format, and data from your account is inserted into individual cells within the spreadsheets.

However, Excel has a limit on the number of characters that a single cell can contain: 32,767 characters. If you attempt to open a spreadsheet file in Excel where any single cell has more than 32,767 characters, Excel will indicate that it found a problem, and will offer to "recover" the file:

If you click Yes, Excel will cut off the content of any cells with more than 32,767 characters to fit within the character limit. For example, if the cell originally contained 70,000 characters, Excel would cut this down to just the first 32,767 characters, and discard the rest.

The problem

In some cases, Bulk Task Smasher can generate files where individual cells exceed Excel's character limit (for example, in cells containing the body text of content Items). Opening these files in Excel and then using the "recover" option would cut down the contents of cells that exceed the character limit, but when this happens Excel does not indicate which cells were cut down.

This creates a risk of data loss if you attempt to use a file affected by this issue as a job template in Bulk Task Smasher: if you are unaware of which cells were cut down and did not remove their contents from the file, Bulk Task Smasher would interpret the shortened cell contents as a change, and would update your Uberflip account accordingly. In practical terms, this means Bulk Task Smasher would shorten content Item body text or other data in your Uberflip account to match what was specified in the affected cells in the job template.

The solution

To help mitigate this risk, Bulk Task Smasher checks all of the files it generates for cells that exceed Excel's character limit and automatically removes the contents of any over-limit cells it finds before making the file available for download.

Whenever this happens, Bulk Task Smasher will notify you with a prompt before the file is downloaded to your computer:

Removing over-limit cell contents ensures you can safely open and edit the file in Excel without the risk of unintentionally making unwanted changes to your Uberflip account due to truncated cell contents. While working with the file in Excel, all affected cells will be blank, and will be highlighted with a comment flag:

Alternative options for advanced users

The single-cell character limit of 32,767 characters only applies to Microsoft Excel: other spreadsheet programs have their own (often higher) limits  — or even no limit at all. For example, the single-cell character limit in Google Sheets is 50,000 characters, in OpenOffice Calc it is 65,535, and both LibreOffice Calc and Apple Numbers do not place any limit on the number of characters in a cell.

If you want to use a spreadsheet program other than Excel to work with the files generated by Bulk Task Smasher, you can choose to download the files with the contents of over-limit cells left intact (not removed).

To do this, click on Advanced options in the character limit warning, then check the box next to I understand the risks, download this file with the over-limit cells included. You will then be given the option of downloading a Non Excel Compatible version of the file:

Please note that using this option is at your own risk, and you should be aware of any cell character limits in the spreadsheet program you intend to use.

articles.name: Internal: Penetration Testing
articles.title: Internal: Penetration Testing
articles.body:
Learn everything you need to know about Penetration testing. This includes what information to request/ how to submit a JIRA ticket for customers interested in running Penetration Testing.

 

Before you begin

  • The processes described in this article are intended for use by Uberflip Support Team.

 

Penetration Testing & What You Need To Know

What is Penetration Testing?

Penetration Testing includes any testing that involves attempting to break in (either virtually or for real) to gain unauthorized access to any Uberflip platform. This does not include vulnerability scanning where data is collected to identify potential or known vulnerabilities, but makes no attempt to exploit them. All Penetration Tests must follow the Uberflip Penetration Testing Rules of Engagement.

 

What are the 'Rules of Engagement'?

Before any testing can commence, customers must request written permission to perform the Penetration Testing. Requests can be made by email to support@uberflip.com. Uberflip Support will then need to submit a JIRA ticket and send an email with required details to security@uberflip.com. (These steps are outlined below).

Along with the request from the customer, the customer will need to provide Uberflip Support with the following information:

- IP ranges the tests will be originating from

- Dates and times of the testing

- Point of contact

For customers of Uberflip, the Penetration Testing results are subject to their confidentiality obligations in the agreement between customer and Uberflip. If they are not currently a customer, they will need to enter into a NDA with Uberflip prior to conducting the penetration testing.

 

What happens if the customer doesn't follow the proper procedure?

All Penetration Tests must follow the Uberflip Penetration Testing Rules of Engagement. The use of the Uberflip platform will continue to be subject to the terms and conditions of the agreement(s) under which the customer purchased the relevant service. Any violation of these Rules of Engagement or the relevant service terms may result in suspension or termination of the customers account and legal action as set forth in the Uberflip Service Terms. The customer is responsible for any damage to Uberflip platforms or other customers data that is caused by any failure to abide by these Rules of Engagement or the Uberflip Service Terms.

 

Is there any type of Penetration testing that is prohibited?

The following activities are prohibited:

- Scanning or testing assets belonging to any other Uberflip customers.

- Gaining access to any data that is not wholly your own.

- Performing any kind of denial of service testing.

- Performing network intensive fuzzing.

- Performing automated testing of services that generates significant amounts of traffic.

- Deliberately accessing any other customer’s data.

- Moving beyond “proof of concept” steps (i.e. proving that you have system access is acceptable, running further scripts or commands to copy, delete, or modify data is not).

- Using our services in a way that violates the Acceptable Use Policy.

- Attempting phishing or other social engineering attacks against our employees.

- Using any Uberflip asset to launch attacks against third parties.

Even with these prohibitions, Uberflip reserves the right to respond to any actions on its networks that appear to be malicious. Uberflip uses a number of security mechanisms to protect our platforms. These will not be disabled to facilitate a penetration test. Depending on the severity of the impact, the response may include anything from Uberflip contacting the account owner, to blocking all traffic from the originating IP, to disabling the customer’s account entirely.

 

Process: Requesting Penetration Testing

Use this process to request penetration testing.

1. Customer must request written permission to perform Penetration Testing to support@uberflip.com. Along with request the customer must include the following in their email to Support (these are the details outlined in the Rules of Engagement)

- IP ranges the tests will be originating from

- Dates and times of the testing

- Point of contact

2. Internally submit a JIRA ticket to our Development team outlining the customers request and the 3 requirements from the Rules of Engagement. The Development will take approximately 5 business days to get back to you with either acceptance, declining or requiring more details from the original request.

3. Internally send an email to security@uberflip.com including the same details as the JIRA ticket. 

4. Share the information with the customer.

articles.name: Adjusting PDF Page Dimension
articles.title: Adjusting PDF Page Dimension
articles.body:
Are you receiving the following error when trying to upload a Flipbook:

  • Page dimensions exceeded: The maximum page size is 430 square inches

Learn how to adjust your PDFs to avoid page dimension issues.

 

Before You Begin

  • To follow these guidelines, you will need Adobe Acrobat Pro.
  • The settings described in this article may not be optimal for your specific PDF, and are only intended as guidelines. You should always ensure that your PDF is displaying content properly before uploading it to Uberflip.
  • Some versions of Adobe Acrobat Pro have a bug where internal page links in the PDF are discarded during optimization. If you need internal page links, either create them after optimizing your PDF, or after converting it to a Flipbook with the Auto-Link or Page Editor tools.

1. Open the PDF file with Acrobat DC

 

2.  Go to Tools > Print Production.

 

3.  Select Preflight from the right pane

     

 

 
 

4. In the Preflight dialog box, click Select single fixups

   

 

5. Now expand the heading that says "Pages"

 

6. Under pages, look for a fixup which says "Scale pages to specified size", and then click the Edit   button after highlighting the fixup

   

 

7. Now enter the page measurements in the Scale pages section:

    - Short edge: Width

    -Long edge: Height

     

 

8. Now click on OK

9. Save the file using the Save dialog box.

articles.name: Announcement: Action required for Uberflip app updates
articles.title: Announcement: Action required for Uberflip app updates
articles.body:
We'll soon be releasing major updates for certain Marketplace apps. Learn which apps are affected, and what actions you will need to take to ensure your apps keep working without interruption.

Who is affected by this change?

This change affects any Uberflip customer who is currently using any of the following Uberflip-developed apps:

  • 6sense Personalizer
  • Demandbase Personalizer
  • Query String Personalizer
  • Bombora Personalizer
  • Clearbit Personalizer
  • Rollworks Personalizer
  • History
  • Lightbox
  • Sales Assist
  • Flipbot

 

What's changing?

Uberflip is making updates to a number of apps which will require users to take action before and after they install the update. If you do not take the necessary actions, these app will lose some or all functionalities.

There are two types of updates:

  • Adding Stream-level app changes - Some apps are being updated with stream-level settings. After the app is updated the Stream IDs field will be removed from these apps and the app will not function until the user re-configures the app at the Stream level. The following apps are being updated with Stream-level settings:
    • 6sense Personalizer
    • Demandbase Personalizer
    • Query String Personalizer
    • Bombora Personalizer
    • Clearbit Personalizer
    • Rollworks Personalizer
    • History
    • Lightbox
  • Replacing app configuration controls - Certain apps are being enhanced with newly added setting controls, such as drop downs. After you update these apps, the values previously set in the affected controls will be lost, and you must manually reconfigure the affected settings using the new controls. The following apps are being updated with config field replacements:
    • Sales Assist
    • Flipbot

 

Benefits of these changes

  • We are making these changes to the Uberflip-developed apps to provide you with a more user-friendly experience by make the app settings easier to configure and manage.
  • These changes also provide you with greater precision to control your app settings. Before this update, apps had to be configured at either Account or Hub level. Customizing these apps at the Stream level was not possible. With the new app update, customizing settings at the Stream level is now possible. For example, customized Page Titles can now to set at the Stream level instead of choosing a generic title at the Account or Hub level.
  • In the case of the stream level change, the existing Stream IDs field can only store a maximum of 30 stream IDs, this constraint will be removed with the new app update.
  • In the case of the config level change, some fields have been converted to drop down lists to avoid typographical errors from occurring.

 

What do I need to do to prepare for these changes?

Apps with new Stream-level settings

If you are using any of the apps that are being updated with Stream-level changes (What's changing?), you will need to save your current Stream IDs before updating the app(s), then enable the app(s) on these Streams individually after updating. Also, you may have specified Stream IDs at the Account level, Hub level, or both. Hence, you should check both locations for Stream IDs. Implement the following steps in the order they are listed:

  1. In the Uberflip platform, click on Account Settings in the drop down list on top right side, select the Integration drop down list in the sidebar menu, click on Installed Apps, select the Edit (pencil) button for the app you would like to update. Make a note of all the stream ID's entered in the Stream ID field in each app. These are the account level stream IDs.

    For the Hub level stream IDs (for hubs that are an exception to the Account level settings) click on the Hubs drop down list in the main navigation menu, select Integration from the sidebar menu, click on Installed Apps, click on the Edit (pencil) button for the required app and note down the Stream IDs.
  2. Download the new app update by clicking on Browse Apps option in the Marketplace drop down list in the main navigation menu. Locate the required app and click on the Update button on the left. Once the update is completed, the app will turn off for the list of Stream IDs that were entered in the app previously.
  3. In the Uberflip platform, select the required Hub from the main navigation menu, click on the Content option in the sidebar menu, select the Streams tab, select the streams you had noted down in step 1, click on the App Configurations tab, select the apps you had previously used with this stream from the App drop down list and click on the Enable switch to change it to the on (green) position.

  4. Repeat step 3 for all required streams.

 

Apps with new configuration controls

If you are using any of the apps that are being updated with configuration control changes (What's changing?), you will need to save your current config control setting before updating the app(s), then select the desired config setting for each app after updating them. Also, you may have specified config control settings at the Account level, Hub level, or both. Hence, you should check both locations for these settings. Implement the following steps in the order they are listed:

  1. In the Uberflip platform, click on Account Settings in the drop down list on top right side, select the Integration drop down list in the sidebar menu, select Installed Apps and click on the Edit (pencil) button for the required app. Select the desired option from the Data Source (in the Sales Assist app), MAP Integration Type (in the Flipbot app) and CTA Gate (in the Flipbot app) drop down list (according to the entries noted down in step 1).

    For the Hub level settings (for hubs that are an exception to the account level settings) click on the Hubs drop down list in the main navigation menu, select Integration from the sidebar menu, click on Installed Apps, click on the Edit (pencil) button for the required app and note down the entries in the Data Source (in the Sales Assist app), MAP Integration Type (in the Flipbot app) and CTA Gate (in the Flipbot app) fields.
  2. Download the new app update by clicking on Browse Apps option in the Marketplace drop down list in the main navigation menu. Locate the required app and click on the Update button on the left. Once the update is completed, the Data Source, MAP Integration Type and CTA Gate drop down lists will now be empty.
  3. In the Uberflip platform, click on Account Settings in the drop down list on top right side, select the Integration drop down list in the sidebar menu, select Installed Apps and click on the Edit (pencil) button for the required app. Select the required option from the Data Source (in the Sales Assist app), MAP Integration Type (in the Flipbot app) and CTA Gate (in the Flipbot app) drop down list (according to the entries noted down in step 1).
  4. In the Uberflip platform, select the required hub from the main navigation menu, select Integrations, click on Installed Apps, select the Flipbot or Sales Assist app from the list of apps. Select the required option from the Data Source (in the Sales Assist app), MAP Integration Type (in the Flipbot app) and CTA Gate (in the Flipbot app) drop down list (according to the entries noted down in step 1).

What will happen if I don’t do anything?

After the aforementioned Uberflip-developed apps are updated, the app will not work until these settings are re-configured. Re-configuring these settings might prove difficult if you have not made a note of the previous field entries and settings before updating the app.

You may reach out to the Uberflip team to help you retrieve your old entries and settings if the instructions in this article are not carried out before an app update.

articles.name: Add an internal name to a Stream
articles.title: Add an internal name to a Stream
articles.body:
Learn how you can add internal names to your Streams to make it easier to identify and manage them.

 

Before you begin

  • By default, members of the Account Administrators and Content Managers user groups can add or edit internal Stream names. The following permissions control the ability to add or edit internal Stream names:
    • For Source Streams: Streams > Native Streams > Update and Delete
    • For Marketing Streams: Streams > Marketing Streams > Update and Delete
    • For Sales Streams: Streams > Sales Streams > Update Update and Delete

 

About internal Stream names

When you create a new Stream, you need to set at least a page title for that Stream. This page title is shown within Uberflip:

And it is also displayed as the Stream's title when the Stream is viewed in your Hub:

However, because it's intended to be publicly visible, the page title of a Stream often isn't very useful for working with your Streams as an Uberflip content manager. For example, you might need to know which of a given set of Streams was used for a particular campaign — but since the campaign name probably wasn't part of the page title, this can be challenging.

That is why assigning internal names to your Streams is useful: a Stream's internal name is only shown in the Uberflip app (not when the Stream is viewed in your Hub), which allows you to include any information you need (or even design and use a consistent naming convention):

This makes it a lot easier to manage your Streams at a glance, and keep track of what each one is for without having to dig into the Stream itself.

 

Add an internal name to a new Stream

You can set an internal name on any Source, Marketing, or Sales Stream when you create it.

  1. Log in to Uberflip and use the Hubs menu to select the Hub you want to work in.
  2. In the sidebar on the left, click on Content.
  3. On the right side, make sure you're on the Streams tab, then click the New Stream +  button:
  4. Choose the type of Stream you want to create, along with any options as needed. On the page where you set the page title, description, etc., use the Internal Stream Name field to specify the internal name you want to assign to this Stream:
  5. Once the Stream has been created, the internal name you chose will be visible on the Streams tab in the Content section, under the Internal Stream Name column:
  6. The internal name is only shown in the Uberflip app — as before, only the page title will be visible when the Stream is viewed in your Hub:

Note

Setting an internal Stream name is optional when you create a Stream, so you can also leave the Internal Stream Name field blank if you prefer. If you do, Uberflip will automatically set the Stream's internal name to be the same as its page title. If you change your mind, you can always add an internal Stream name later.

 

Edit the internal name of an existing Stream

You can change the internal name of any existing Stream at any time. If you didn't set an internal name for a Stream when you first created it, you can use this method to add an internal name later.

  1. Log in to Uberflip and use the Hubs menu to select the Hub you want to work in.
  2. In the sidebar on the left, click on Content.
  3. Make sure you're on the Streams tab, then find the Stream to which you want to add an internal name.
  4. Click on the Stream to edit it.
  5. At the top of the Stream's edit page, you should see three editable text fields. From top to bottom, these are the Stream's internal name, page title, and description:
  6. Click on the Edit (pencil) button beside the internal name (the largest text, at the top), to edit it:
  7. Type in a new internal name, then click the checkmark button:
  8. Your new internal Stream name will be saved automatically, and will be applied to the Stream immediately.

Tips

  • The Internal Stream Name column on the Content > Streams page is sortable — just click on it to sort your list of Streams alphabetically by the Streams' internal names.
  • You can also use the Search box to search your Streams by their internal names (as well as their page titles, descriptions, etc.).

articles.name: Uberflip Streams explained
articles.title: Uberflip Streams explained
articles.body:
This article outlines Uberflip Streams, including what they are and how to use them in your Hub.

 

What are Streams?

Streams are collections of content in your Hub. There are 2 main Stream types: Source Streams and curated Streams.

  • Source Streams are used to import (and sometimes create) content in your Hub. They also house the imported content by its source to keep it organized. Each Source Stream can only contain a single type of content from a single source.
  • Curated Streams are used to create targeted/personalized content experiences using different types of content. Marketing Streams and Sales Streams are both types of curated Streams. Curated Streams contain a mix of different content types chosen for a specific audience or prospect.

 

Stream types explained

Here's a deeper look at Streams and their sub-types: 

Source Streams

These Stream types are used to import content into your Hub from external sources (and, in some cases, to create new content directly within your Hub).

Source Streams can be broken into 4 sub-types: 

Document 

Includes: Flipbooks/PDFs

Document Streams are used to import PDF content such as ebooks, white papers, brochures, infographics, etc., as well as presentation slides into Uberflip. You can choose to display PDF content in its original format, or convert it into Uberflip's Flipbooks format for more granular analytics data. 

SlideShare Streams are being retired

The ability to create new SlideShare Streams has ended. Check out SlideShare Streams are being retired [Nov. 2023] for details. 

Video

Includes: YouTube, Vimeo, Wistia, Vidyard, Brightcove

With Video Streams, you can import your video content from a variety of video hosting services. You can integrate your YouTube, Vimeo, Wistia, Vidyard and Brightcove accounts, and pull in videos from that account (typically either all videos, or selected collections/playlists) to create individual video Items in Uberflip.

Blog

Blog Streams are used to aggregate blog content in your Hub. You can either continuously import content from an externally hosted blog (e.g. WordPress) via its RSS feed, or create a brand new blog from scratch within your Uberflip Hub. Both options will create individual blog post Items in your Hub, which typically form the backbone of your top-of-funnel content.

When you import an external blog into Uberflip, this can either be a blog you own, or a third-party blog. The second option is useful if you want to pull in feeds from influencers or popular industry blogs to round out your Hub’s content.

If you instead choose to create a new blog from scratch with Uberflip's integrated blogging functionality, you'll need to manually add content to it by using the built-in blog post editor. You can also use this same built-in blogging functionality on Blog Streams that import content from an external blog, either to manually add new posts from within Uberflip or to modify imported posts.

To learn more, see Create a Blog Stream.

 

Curated Streams
