  • Choose this option to use Sales Assist without having to leave Outlook. This allows you to easily access Sales Assist while you're doing email outreach.

To access Sales Assist using the Outlook Add-in:

  • Install the Sales Assist Add-in for Outlook: see this article for detailed instructions on how to get and install the Add-in.

No matter which option you choose to access Sales Assist, the login process is the same:

  1. Click on Login with Uberflip.
  2. Enter your Uberflip username (email) and click Next.
  3. Enter your password and click Log In.
    • If your organization uses a Single Sign-On service (like Okta) to log in to Uberflip, click on the Log in with... button instead of entering your password, then sign in as normal. After you sign in, you'll be redirected back to Sales Assist.

That's it! You're logged in to Sales Assist, and can begin using the app.

Step 2: Gather content to share

Step 2.1: Search for content

Next, use Search to find some content to share with your prospects. First, choose how you want to find content:

View the most shared content Search the content library Search Marketing Streams

If you just need some content fast, click on the See Most Shared button:

This will show you the top content that's been shared the most often by other Sales Users in your organization.

If you're looking for something specific, use the search tools.

  1. In the All Items tab, type one or more keywords into the search box (1).
    Optional: add tag (2) or content type (3) filters.
  2. Browse the list of search results to find the content you want:
    Tip: By default, the list of search results will be sorted by Most Shared. Use the dropdown menu in the top right to sort the search results by Newest or Alphabetical instead:

Go to the Marketing Streams tab to search ready-made collections of content within your content library:

  1. Type one or more keywords into the search box to search for specific content collections.
  2. Browse the list of search results to see available collections.
  3. To view content within a collection, hover your mouse over it and then click on Items:

 

Step 2.2: Add content to your basket

When you find some content that you want to share, add it to your basket. Content in the basket will be included in the custom, personalized destination you'll share with your prospect.

      1. To add some content to your basket, hover your mouse over that content, then click on Add:

        Can't see the Add button?

        If you don't see the Add button, this means that your Sales Assist admin has disabled the ability to create Streams from scratch. Don't worry — just skip to step 3.

      2. Your basket is shown at the bottom or right of the page (depending on where you're using Sales Assist).
        Here you'll also see how many items you've already added:

Tip

Not sure if a piece of content is exactly what you're looking for? Hover your mouse over it, click Details, then click the Preview tab to view it:

Step 3: Create a personalized destination

Use the content in your basket to create a personalized destination for your prospect. We call this destination a "Stream" — a custom microsite that you can set up in seconds:

  1. With content items in your basket, click on the New Stream button:
    • You can also create a new Stream by clicking on Streams at the top, then clicking on the +New button:

      (This option is especially useful if you couldn't add content to your basket in Step 2.)
  2. Fill out the Create a New Sales Stream form to personalize the destination for your prospect:

    • Heading: This is your destination's headline, shown in large text across the top.
    • Message: Use this to enter a brief personalized message for your prospect. It's shown immediately below the heading.
    • Prospect: Enter the email or just the domain (the part of the email after the @ symbol) of your prospect. Don't worry, nothing will be sent to them yet! Sales Assist just uses this information to find the prospect's company logo.
    • Template: Select a premade template to style your destination (i.e. the banner, colors, etc.).
  3.  When you're done, click Create Stream.
  4. Your destination will now be created, and you'll be taken to the Manage Stream page. Here you can make necessary tweaks, add a welcome video, and preview the Stream you just made:

When you're happy with how everything looks, your destination is ready to be shared!

For a more in-depth look at creating and managing Streams, check out: Sales Assist: Create, manage, and share Streams.

 

Step 4: Share the destination with your prospect

Now that you've set up the destination, you'll create a trackable embed link to it that you can share with your prospect.

  1. On the Manage Stream page, click on the Share button:
  2. Choose the embed option you want to use. There are five options, with previews:
    1. Banner Image with Logos*: Your logo and your prospect’s logo over your Stream's banner.
      *This option is only available when:
      • A logo has been uploaded to the Hub Thumbnail field in your Uberflip account  (Appearance > Branding > Images (photo icon) > Hub Thumbnail)
      • You have set a prospect logo on the Manage Stream page
      • The Stream has a banner image set
    2. Image and Text: Link preview, with logos and Stream heading. 
      Note: If a prospect logo or Hub Thumbnail is not set, logos will be replaced by Stream description.
    3. Tile Image: A compact image that functions as a clickable link to the content.
    4. Just Text: Just a text link, no image.
    5. Just the Link: No embed, just the underlying URL (including its share tracking code) that you can link to.
  3. Click on Copy to Clipboard under the option you want to use...
  4. ...then just paste the link into an email (or anywhere else you want to share it):
  5. Now, just hit Send and wait for your prospect to start engaging with your content!

 

Step 5: Track engagement and follow up

Every link you share through Sales Assist has tracking built in. Sales Assist will notify you anytime someone is checking out the content you've shared, so that you can follow up with the right people at just the right time.

  1. As long as you're still logged in to Sales Assist in at least one browser tab (or if the extension is open), you'll get a notification:
  2. And if you miss a notification, you can always click on Shares to catch up on historical engagement and stats:

For more information on tracking engagement and stats, check out Sales Assist: Track Stream engagement. 

 

What's next?

Great job, you're up and running with Sales Assist!

We only covered the basics in this quick start guide, and there's a lot more you can do with Sales Assist:

  • Create your own content and templates
  • Customize your Streams with:
    • a welcome video 
    • Stream sections
    • a passphrase 
    • and more
  • Manage your Streams 

If you want to learn more about these features and more, check out the Sales Assist section of the Uberflip Help Center.

articles.name: Hub or Stream Authentication login page shows HTML code
articles.title: Hub or Stream Authentication login page shows HTML code
articles.body:
Issue

Raw HTML code is being displayed the Hub and/or Stream Authentication login page.

  • Header and footer HTML shown on authentication/login page
  • Hub/Stream auth page looks messy

 

Conditions

  • Stream and/or Hub Authentication pages are enabled
  • Hub has custom code for injected header and footer
  • Where: On any Stream and/or Hub authentication pages
  • Who: Any user viewing the Stream and/or Hub authentication pages in the affected Hub
  • When: Any time
  • Not browser or OS-specific

 

Cause

HTML from the injected header and footer is being loaded on the page, but no CSS or JavaScript is loaded to style the page.

 

Steps to Fix

For TV1 Hubs, add the following CSS in the Body Bottom placement:

<style>
/******* remove injected header and footer on auth pages *******/
.stream-login #injected-header,
.stream-login #injected-footer {
display: none;
}
</style>

TV2 equivalent when a theme is in use is 

<style>
.uf-stream-login .uf-hf {
display: none;
}
</style>

The TV2 equivalent when a theme is not in use is

 <style>
.uf-stream-login #injected header, .uf-stream-login #injected-footer {
display: none;
}
</style>

articles.name: Internal: Salesforce Integration | Troubleshooting Guide
articles.title: Internal: Salesforce Integration | Troubleshooting Guide
articles.body:
The following guide lists troubleshooting options and issues that client's can/have run into when trying to connect to our Salesforce Integration.

 

  1.  Ensure that the client creates the Salesforce "Contact ID" or "Lead ID" (lead/contact/prospect  fields) in the MAP.

    We have had issues where the client exposed the Salesforce field itself in the MAP without actually creating the lead/contact/prospect field in the MAP. The integration looks for the Salesforce synced field in the MAP, so if the field is not a MAP field, then the lookup won't find it.

    This pertains to this "setup" section of the integration guide (https://help.uberflip.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047293692-Set-up-a-Salesforce-integration#prerequisite-sync-lead-profiles-between-your-map-and-salesforce), where the client then tried to lookup the field in the "Marketing Automation Platform (MAP) Integration" section (https://help.uberflip.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047293692-Set-up-a-Salesforce-integration#step-2-configure-salesforce-integration-settings). 


  2. Verify that the field type is a "Text" field.

articles.name: Migrate a Pardot integration to a Salesforce SSO account
articles.title: Migrate a Pardot integration to a Salesforce SSO account
articles.body:
Objective

Follow these instructions to migrate your Pardot integration from a Pardot-only account to a Salesforce SSO account.

 

Prerequisite: Get your Pardot and Salesforce login credentials

Before you begin, you will need to gather various pieces of ID information from your Pardot/Salesforce accounts. See the main Pardot setup article for details on what you will need and how to find it:

  • Integrate Pardot with your Uberflip account

 

Switch your Pardot integration to a Salesforce SSO account

  1. Log in to Uberflip.
  2. Click on Integrations > Connected Services in the sidebar menu.
  3. In the Connected Services list on the right, find Pardot.
  4. Beside Pardot, click on the Edit button in the Action column:
  5. In the Edit Settings window, click on the Change your Pardot login link in near the top:
  6. In the next window, enter your Pardot Account ID, Campaign ID, and Business Unit ID, then click on Save & Connect:
  7. The Salesforce login screen will appear in a new window. Enter the credentials of the Salesforce SSO account that you want to use with the integration, then click on Log In.
  8. Next, you may see prompt asking if you want to allow Uberflip to access your Pardot account. If you see this prompt, click on the Allow button to proceed.
  9. You'll be returned to the Uberflip Connected Services menu. The Pardot integration will still show as "connected", indicating that you have successfully migrated it to the specified Salesforce SSO account.

 

Additional Notes

If you set up your Pardot integration before February 5, 2021 using a Pardot-only account, you must migrate your integration to a Salesforce SSO account to keep it working, as per Salesforce's updated account requirements.

articles.name: Theme a Hub using the Theme Selector app
articles.title: Theme a Hub using the Theme Selector app
articles.body:
Use the Theme Selector app to quickly and easily change the look and feel of your Hub by applying premade themes.

Warning: Internal use only

Theme Selector is for internal use only.

  • During the initial soft launch/beta period, the app should only be used by internal users (primarily CSMs and Implementation Specialists) on behalf of customers. 
  • In anticipation of a potential public release, this article was written with an external (customer) audience in mind. However, this article is NOT intended to be shared externally at this time. Note also that certain details in this article (including the name of the app) may differ from what you see in the beta version of the app.
  • UPDATE (Feb. 14, 2022): This app has been renamed to PLT-0 Poch, in line with the codenames used for Project LEGO apps during the internal release phase.

For more information, please contact Zayyan Chowdhury or Chris Johnson.

Before you begin

  • Before you can use the Theme Selector app, you need to install it from the Uberflip Marketplace (click on Marketplace in the top navigation in Uberflip).
  • To use this app, your Hub must be running Front End V2. The app is not compatible with Front End V1 Hubs. If you're not sure which version of the Uberflip Hub Front End your Hub is using, see this article.
  • To configure the app, it is helpful (but not required) to have some knowledge of basic HTML tags, CSS properties, and related concepts (e.g. HTML color codes).
  • This app is intended to be used with pre-launch Hubs (i.e. Hubs that are still in the implementation stage, and are not yet live on the web). Because it immediately changes the appearance and behavior of your Hub, using this app with live/production Hubs is not recommended.

 

About the Theme Selector app

Out of the box, the design of an Uberflip Hub is clean and responsive — but also quite basic. That's intentional, because we know that most of our customers like to extensively customize the design of their Hubs to meet brand guidelines, match existing websites, or just to achieve a particular look and feel.

If you have the time and development budget, you can use custom code to make your Hub look pretty much however you want. But this can be time-consuming and expensive, and sometimes you just need to get a Hub up and running fast — and while you want it to look good, you're not looking for an elaborate and hyper-customized design.

If that sounds like you, the Theme Selector app is exactly what you're looking for. With Theme Selector, you can apply themes to your Hub: ready-made designs that completely change your Hub's look and feel in seconds, all without needing to write a single line of code.

How does it work?

Theme Selector themes are premade customizations for Uberflip Hubs. Think of them as the off-the-shelf equivalent of a fully-custom Hub front end: you don't get to customize every aspect, but you do get a great-looking, professionally designed Hub in a fraction of the time.

Theme Selector themes work essentially the same way as themes you might have used on other web platforms, such as WordPress Themes: just pick a theme and apply it, and your Hub is instantly transformed.

For example, you can make your Hub go from this:

To this:

All in seconds, and with just a few clicks.

With all themes, you can set the colors of specific elements and import custom fonts, and some even have advanced features and functionality that can be customized to your preferences. And because all themes are loaded into your Hub from a centralized repository, there are no manual downloads or ZIP files to deal with.

Where can I find themes?

Theme Selector is currently in beta, so both the app itself and the themes are still under development. This means that there may be some bugs, and that certain features of the app still require advanced configuration (i.e. editing custom code snippets).

As a result, you'll need to work with your Customer Success Manager or Implementation Specialist to get access to and install themes at this time. To get started, please get in touch with your CSM or IS.

 

Setup

Before you can begin using Theme Selector, you need to ensure the Compatibility Pack app is installed in your Uberflip account. This app is required to make most apps work correctly with Front End V2, the technology that powers current Uberflip Hubs.

To install the Compatibility Pack app, simply go to the Marketplace in Uberflip, then search for "Compatibility Pack" and click Install.

 

Apply a theme

Info

You configure this app at the Hub level, which means that your settings will apply only to the Hub you are currently working in. If you have multiple Hubs, you must configure (and use) this app separately in each Hub.

Once you have installed Theme Selector in your Uberflip account and have selected a theme, you can apply the theme to any Hub within your account.

To apply a theme, you will need:

  • Its theme code, which uniquely identifies the theme. Your Uberflip CSM or IS will provide you with the theme code for your selected theme.
  • The theme documentation, which describes how the theme works and how to configure theme-specific functionality and settings. It generally also tells you which front end elements are affected by Theme Selector's color settings, and in some cases provides a custom code snippet that you will need to install on your Hub(s) to allow the theme to work properly.

Make sure to read the theme documentation for your selected theme carefully before proceeding. When you're ready to apply the theme to your Hub, follow the instructions below:

  1. Log in to your Uberflip account as an Account Administrator or Content Manager.
  2. Navigate to the Hub where you want to apply the theme.
  3. If your chosen theme requires a custom code snippet (see the theme documentation for your theme), add it to your Hub now before going any further.
    • See this article for instructions on how to add custom code to your Hub.
  4. In the Uberflip sidebar menu, click on Integrations, then click on Installed Apps:
  5. In the list of apps on the right, find Theme Selector and hover your mouse over it. Click on the Edit (pencil) button that appears on the right:

  6. This will open the settings menu for Theme Selector. To apply your chosen theme, simply type its theme code into the field under Selected theme:
  7. The selected theme will be applied immediately with default colors and settings. To see the results in your Hub, click on the Open Hub button at the top of the sidebar menu:

Configure a theme

Once you have applied a theme, you can customize specific colors and fonts using the app settings under Integrations > Installed Apps > Theme Selector > Edit.

  • Theme Selector's color and font settings are common to all themes, but the specific elements they control will vary depending on the selected theme. For specific details, refer to the theme documentation for the theme you are using.
  • All color settings will accept values in any standard HTML color format, i.e. HTML/CSS color names (basic and extended), HEX, RGB/RGBA, or HSL/HSLA.
  • When entering any value into settings do not enter a ; (semicolon) after the value, as this will cause CSS problems and the specified color will not be applied. For example:
    • Yes: #CE0058
    • No: #CE0058;
  • All of these settings are optional: if you do not specify anything for a given setting, Theme Selector will simply use the theme default for that setting.

Note

If your selected theme requires a custom code snippet, you can often also customize the snippet to configure advanced functionality available in the theme. Details on how to do so can be found in the theme documentation.

You can find details about the available settings and how to configure them below:

Primary color

Sets the theme's primary color, typically used throughout the theme for prominent visual elements (though this can vary by theme). In most cases, you would set this to your main brand color.

Secondary color

Sets the theme's secondary color, typically used throughout the theme as an accent color (though this can vary by theme). In most cases, you would set this to a secondary brand color or other complementary color.

Headline color

Sets the color of all headings across all pages in your Hub, i.e. any text within heading tags (<h1> to <h6>). This includes page titles, Item tile titles (but not CTA tile taglines), Item Page subheadings, and so on.

Text color

Sets the color of all body text across all pages in your Hub, i.e. any text within paragraph tags (<p>). This includes most non-heading text such as Item page body text and CTA tile taglines, but does not include links (text within <a> tags), including the text links in the Hub menu.

Hover text color

Sets the color of all text in themes that feature a hover effect in which the background color changes.

Most commonly used for Item tiles that have a slide-up-on-hover effect which displays a preview of the content: typically, the Primary color setting will be used for the background color, so this should be set to a color that contrasts well against that color to be readable.

Tile border color

Sets the color of the border of Item and CTA tiles, in themes that use a border. Does not have any effect in themes that do not use tile borders.

Body color

Sets the background color of the document body (everything within the <body> tags) across all pages in your Hub. Note that this does not include the hub menu, header, footer, and any visible tiles, or the article container on Item pages.

.

Hub menu background color

Sets the background color of the Hub menu that's displayed at the top of all pages in your Hub (except in Sales Streams).

Menu text color

Sets the color of the text in the Hub menu (i.e. the menu items).

Tile action text color

Sets the color of the action text on Item tiles, i.e. "Read Article", "Watch Video", etc. Note that this is the "static state" color, and that many themes also apply a "hover state" color for this text on mouse hover (which is typically controlled by another setting depending on theme, such as Primary color, Secondary color or Item link text color).

Item link text color

Sets the color of text links on Item pages only (i.e. text within <a> tags in your content).

Button color

Sets the background color of the various buttons across your Hub, such as the "Return Home" button on Item pages (if used in the current theme).

Primary font link

Sets the custom font used for headings (<h1> to <h6>) on all pages across your Hub. Custom fonts must be hosted (e.g. on a service like Google Fonts) and importable from a URL.

To set a custom font, enter the font's embed link into the field in this format:

<link href="[embed URL goes here]" rel="stylesheet">

For example, for a Google Fonts font, click on +Select this style, choose <link> in the sidebar under Use on the web, and copy and paste this part (you can also include the <link rel="preconnect"... portion if it fits):

Note

There is a character limit of 255 characters on this field, so adding a lot of styles (variants of the same font) can make the embed link exceed this character limit. To avoid this, try to limit the included styles to just those you need.

Primary font family

Set the font-family CSS property (i.e. the font name) for the selected Primary font, along with any fallback fonts in case the Primary font is not available.

To set the font family, enter it into the field in this format. Start with the imported custom font, then any fallback fonts. Do not include font-family: at the beginning, or ; at the end:

'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif

For a Google Fonts font, simply copy and paste this part under CSS rules to specify families (remember to exclude font-family: at the beginning and ; at the end):

Secondary font link

Sets the custom font used for all non-heading text, including links (i.e. text within <p> and <a> tags) on all pages across your Hub. This setting is configured the same way as the Primary font link setting.

Secondary font family

Set the font-family CSS property (i.e. the font name) for the selected Secondary font, along with any fallback fonts in case the Secondary font is not available. This setting is configured the same way as the Primary font family setting.

 

Next steps

Want to further customize your new theme? You can build your own customizations on top of a theme with custom code, or talk to your Customer Success Manager or Implementation Specialist about working with Uberflip's onBrand front end development team.

Also, don't forget about Uberflip's built-in branding and customization settings (for setting banners, logos, favicons, etc.), as well as Marketing and Sales Stream template appearance settings, as they are (generally) compatible with themes!

articles.name: Announcement: Changes to the Pardot integration
articles.title: Announcement: Changes to the Pardot integration
articles.body:
Salesforce is making changes to their login requirements for Pardot users, and we are updating Uberflip's Pardot integration to be compatible with these changes. Learn about the timeline for this change, what it means for you, and what you'll need to do to get ready.

Info

The original February 1 availability date for Salesforce SSO support has been revised to February 5. All references to the availability date in this article have been updated accordingly.

What's changing?

In the past, Pardot supported both Pardot-only users and Salesforce single-sign on (SSO) users. Salesforce (Pardot's parent company) has announced that they are ending support for the Pardot-only user type on February 15, 2021, and that they will require all Pardot users to use Salesforce SSO from that date onward.

This change affects Uberflip's integration with Pardot. In the past, the integration was not compatible with Salesforce SSO accounts, and could only be set up with a Pardot-only account. To ensure that the integration can continue to function, we are updating it to support Salesforce SSO accounts. The updated integration will be available on February 5, 2021.

Users of the Pardot integration will need to take action as a result of this change: to ensure that it keeps working without interruption, you must manually switch your Pardot integration to a Salesforce SSO account. You can do this at any time after February 5.

 

Who is affected by this change?

This change affects any Uberflip customer who:

  1. Currently uses the Pardot integration AND
  2. Set up the integration at any time before February 5, 2021

When you set up a Pardot integration, you must specify a Pardot account: the integration uses this account to authenticate into the connected Pardot environment. Before February 5, 2021, the account could only be a Pardot-only account, because Salesforce SSO accounts were not supported by the integration until that date.

When Salesforce discontinues Pardot-only accounts, this will disconnect any Pardot integration that still uses a Pardot-only account. By definition, this includes any Uberflip Pardot integration set up before February 5, 2021.

 

What do I need to do to be ready for this change?

If you are affected by this change, you must take action to ensure that your Pardot integration continues to work.

Specifically, you must modify your Pardot integration to use a Salesforce SSO account (replacing the Pardot-only account used previously). You can do this on February 5, 2021 or later.

Follow the instructions in the following article to switch your Pardot integration to a Salesforce SSO account:

  • Migrate a Pardot integration to a Salesforce SSO account

 

Is there a deadline for me to take action?

Yes. Salesforce has stated that the requirement to use Salesforce SSO with Pardot will come into effect on February 15. As a result, you should take action by this date.

 

What if I miss this deadline?

After February 15, Salesforce will use a "schedule of controlled outages" for a period of several months. For the duration of a scheduled outage, integrations that use Pardot-only accounts will be disconnected from Pardot.

While the integration is disconnected, any Uberflip Hub functionality associated with the integration will not work. This includes most Form CTA functionality, including:

  • Lead data collection: Visitors will be able to submit Form CTAs, but Uberflip won't be able to send this lead data to Pardot, resulting in data loss
  • Progressive profiling: Any Pardot Form CTA configured to use this feature will not function correctly
  • Automated workflows: Pardot workflows that are started by Form CTA submissions (such as follow-up emails, newsletter subscriptions, etc.) will not trigger

The duration and frequency of the scheduled outages will increase over time, until Salesforce begins permanently enforcing the new requirements on June 15. On this date, any Pardot integration that still uses a Pardot-only account will be disconnected, and will remain disconnected until it is switched to a Salesforce SSO account.

You can find detailed information about this policy of scheduled outages, including the schedule itself, in this article from Salesforce (scroll down to "Pardot API").

You will still be able to switch your Pardot integration to Salesforce SSO at any time after February 15, including after June 15. However, due to the risk of data loss, we strongly encourage you to switch your Pardot integration to Salesforce SSO by February 15 at the latest.

 

Additional information

You can find Salesforce's announcement regarding this change here:

Salesforce: Pardot User Migration Overview 

Salesforce has also provided an FAQ document about this change, which is located here:

Salesforce: Pardot User Migration FAQ

articles.name: Internal: Support and Escalation Processes
articles.title: Internal: Support and Escalation Processes
articles.body:
Learn how to get help from Uberflip's Support team for customer issues, and how to escalate urgent issues.

 

Before you begin

  • The processes described in this article are intended for use by any internal Uberflip team.

 

Getting help from the Support team

How do I get support for a customer issue?

Uberflip's Support team is responsible for handling and resolving issues that our customers have with the Uberflip product. If you need help from the Support team, you can submit a support ticket.

What are support tickets, and why are they important?

Uberflip's Support team receives a lot of requests for help. To manage all of these requests, and to ensure nothing is missed or forgotten, we use a support ticket system. In this system, every request for help is represented by its own support ticket.

Using support tickets allows us to:

  • Keep track of all requests, so that we can make sure that all requests get a response.
  • Centralize communication related to a request, so that everyone involved has a definitive record of what's been discussed, and so we can ensure that every aspect of the request is addressed.
  • Prioritize requests, so that we can handle the most urgent requests first (but without forgetting about requests that are less urgent, but equally important).
  • Guarantee a response within a specific timeframe. In fact, a support ticket is the only way to get help from the Support team that has a Service Level Agreement (SLA) behind it.
  • Measure the business, so we know how well the Support team is performing, and whether the business is growing.
  • Maintain a historical record. This allows us to review past events at the individual customer, account level, and overall Uberflip company level; and serves as proof of interactions. It also provides opportunities to reduce duplication of efforts should the same issue arise again in the future.

In short: support tickets help the Support team to help you.

Do I really have to submit support tickets?

We know that submitting a support ticket seems inconvenient compared to just sending a Slack message. But without support tickets, things get missed or lost altogether — and that makes everyone unhappy (especially customers!). This is why we ask you to submit support tickets: they allow the Support team to do the best possible job for both you and the customer.

Where do support tickets live?

We use Zendesk as our system of record for managing support tickets. That's why you might also see support tickets referred to as "Zendesk tickets".

While it is mainly the Support team that works in Zendesk, all members of the Customer Experience department also have access to this system to check on the status of open support tickets.

Who can submit a support ticket?

Anyone who needs help from Uberflip Support. This could either be an Uberflip customer themselves, or any Uberflip team member who is looking for help on behalf of their customer.

How does a customer submit a support ticket?

There are three methods for customers to submit support tickets:

  • Help Portal: https://help.uberflip.com (click on Submit a Request)
  • Email: support@uberflip.com
  • Phone: 1-888-694-2946 (dial extension 2)

How does an Uberflip team member submit a support ticket?

Follow the the process for submitting a support ticket as an Uberflip team member below.

 

Process: Submit a support ticket

Use this process to submit a new support ticket.

  1. Log in to Zendesk at https://help.uberflip.com/
  2. Click on +Add, then New > Ticket:
  3. Fill in the fields on the left side:
    • Requester: Add the customer's contact information (the person Support should correspond with about the issue).  This is a very critical piece of information. Take the time to get this one correct.
    • CCs: Add yourself and any others who should be copied on all correspondence on this ticket.
    • Type: Select Question.
    • Severity: See Setting severity and priority below.
    • Feature: Select the part of Uberflip that the issue pertains to.
    • Priority: See Setting severity and priority below.
    • Ticket Source: Select the appropriate option as it relates to you (i.e. choose CSM if you are a CSM).
  4. On the right side, click on Internal Note (make sure the field turns yellow), then enter a detailed explanation of the issue.
  5. Click on Submit as New to finish submitting the ticket.

Setting severity and priority

When you submit a support ticket, you will need to specify the severity and priority of the issue:

Severity
A definition of the system impact of a particular issue.
"How broken is it?"
Priority
A measure of how important an issue is from a business and customer impact perspective.
“How much does the customer care?”

The Support team relies on these fields to efficiently prioritize requests, so setting the correct severity and priority for your ticket is very important.

For each field, you will need to choose from a list of options. Each of the available options has a definition that outlines its criteria. You can find these below:

Severity level definitions

Use this table to help you choose the appropriate severity level for your support ticket. Remember: severity tells us how broken the affected system is.

Each severity level is associated with a specific SLA (how quickly the Support team will respond to the customer), which is indicated. In addition, the table also shows the recommended priority level range for each severity level, along with the suggested CSM action.

Severity Definition SLA Priority CS Action
1 Production system down or imminent production mission critical failure, no workaround available. 1 hour 1 Engage immediately
2

Loss of key functionality which affects significant aspects of the business or operations.

 3 hours 2-3 Engage proactively
3

Issue impacting an isolated component that does not affect the ability of the system to perform in accordance with the documentation.

 6 hours 2-4 Monitor closely/engage if needed
4 Product is usable with limitations and workarounds – also a placeholder for general inquiries. 24 hours 2-4 Monitor
5

No system impact identified (e.g. feature tequests, user account requests, software delivery, status reports, etc.).

 48 hours 2-4 Monitor

Priority level definitions

Use this table to help you choose the appropriate priority level for your support ticket. Remember: priority tells us how much the customer cares about this issue (regardless of how broken the affected system is).

Priority Definition
1 - Urgent

Immediate business impact affecting multiple internal initiatives / business objectives. Data loss. Urgently time sensitive issues (i.e. needs to be addressed right now - should be accompanied by an escalation).
2 - High

Blockers/issues that cause major impact to the client’s continued use of the platform or affect other business objectives with no workaround. Highly time sensitive issues (2-3 business days).
3 - Normal

Standard support issue or inquiry. This should be used for the vast majority of tickets.
4 - Low

General questions about the platform. Issues with very little to no impact.

Common mistakes

Here are some common mistakes to avoid when submitting a support ticket:

  • Filing the ticket under your own name, instead of the customer's:
    When you submit the ticket, remember to set the customer as the Requester, not yourself! We need this information to contact the client, and if it's missing, this causes delays.
  • Creating a ticket by forwarding a customer email to support@uberflip.com:
    This also sets you (not the customer) as the Requester, and causes delays as we have to fix the ticket. In addition, often the customer's email is not clear, or worse, consists of a long thread of messages.  Instead, please follow the instructions above for submitting a ticket and paste the customer's email address into the Internal Note field when you create the ticket according to the process above.
  • Not providing any or enough details about the issue: If the ticket doesn't have enough information for us to go on, all we can do is ask you or the customer for the missing information. This typically results in back and forth that wastes time and is frustrating for the customer. To avoid this, please include as many details as possible, i.e. which Hub and/or specific assets are affected, steps to reproduce the issue, etc. You should also:
    • Verify that the issue exists as described by the client
    • Describe the issue clearly and concisely in the ticket
    • Provide a clear indication of the impact this issue is having for your client

As a general rule, a good support ticket is one where Support can get back to the customer with a first response directly, and does not have to follow up with you first.

 

Escalating support tickets

What does it mean to escalate a support ticket?

From time to time, issues come up that are extremely urgent, and need to be resolved as soon as possible. For these issues, you have the ability to escalate a support ticket.

When you ask for a support ticket to be escalated, you are effectively telling the Support team:

"I want you to drop what you're doing and work on this ticket ahead of all other ongoing activities."

Is there anything I need to consider before I request an escalation?

While tickets legitimately need to be escalated in some situations, always remember that escalations come at a cost:

  • Escalations are disruptive: they have a significant negative effect on productivity, often across multiple departments (Support, Product, Engineering, etc.), and force those involved to catch up on their regular duties after the escalation is resolved
  • Escalations are expensive: they typically require expensive resources (management, developers, etc.) to take time away from their ongoing work to focus exclusively
  • Escalations result in poor customer experiences: an escalation makes one customer happy, but potentially makes all other customers unhappy because work on their issues has to be delayed

Before you escalate a ticket, keep the impact in mind and use your judgment to make sure that the situation really does call for an escalation. In some cases, this might mean reaching out to a customer to manage their expectations instead of escalating the ticket.

When should I escalate a support ticket?

There are many situations where an escalation is warranted, and a comprehensive list of these situations would be impractical and not very useful. As a result, the Support team relies on you to use your judgment as to when an escalation is required.

Below are a few examples of situations that would call for an escalation:

  • The customer has made it clear to you that this issue is critical to their business objectives, so much so that it should take precedence over everything else currently being worked on.
  • The issue is time sensitive, e.g. the issue is preventing another process from being started or completed. In this case, it's important to indicate how time sensitive the issue is (one hour and one month require different levels or response).
  • The issue could impact churn or revenue, e.g. the customer is at high risk for churning, or will not discuss renewal/upgrade until the issue is resolved.

How do I escalate a support ticket?

Follow the process for escalating a support ticket below.

 

Process: Escalate a support ticket

Use this process to escalate an existing support ticket. Remember to use your judgment and make sure it's necessary to escalate the ticket before you proceed.

  1. In Slack, go to the #support-escalation channel.
  2. Click on the Workflows button at the top of the channel:
  3. Click on the Escalate Support Ticket shortcut from within the dropdown menu:
  4. Fill out the form with all relevant details about the support ticket to be escalated, including Business Impact, then click on Submit to post the escalation to the channel:
  5. In a follow-up message, @here and @mention the Support Representative who is assigned to the ticket currently.
  6. Support will review the escalation request. If it is deemed to be a valid escalation, the Support Representative will respond to your request for escalation within the #support-escalation channel and immediately proceed to work the ticket until a resolution is achieved.
  7. Continue to monitor the ticket until it has been resolved.

If you do not receive a response to your escalation within 30 minutes:

If required, reach out to the following individual Support team members using Slack or email, in the following order:

  1. Team Leads, Technical Support
    • Roshan Kathir (Slack: Roshan, Email: roshan.kathirgamasegaran@uberflip.com)
    • Tommy Bozikis (Slack: Tommy Bozikis, Email: tommy.bozikis@uberflip.com)
    • If no response:
  2. Director, Technical Support
    • Wes Ivany (Slack: Wes Ivany, Email: weston.ivany@uberflip.com)

Rejected escalations

If your escalation is rejected, follow these next steps:

  • Ensure all required information is present in the notification to #support-escalation.
  • Work with the Support Representative to ensure the business impact is well defined. Support must have a clear understanding of how the issue is affecting the customer before a ticket can be escalated.

Note also that Support will update the customer if required with appropriate information, regardless of whether the escalation is accepted.

After hours escalations

The operating hours of the Support team are currently 8 AM to 8 PM Eastern Time, Monday to Friday. (Excluding statutory holidays, which currently have operating hours of 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time) Escalations are possible outside of these hours, and follow the normal procedure outlined above.

If you do not receive a response from Support to your after-hours escalation within a reasonable timeframe:

  1. Contact your manager. They will directly contact the Director of Technical Support (Wes Ivany), who will coordinate with the Support team.
  2. Continue to monitor the relevant support ticket as well as the #support-escalation channel for updates.

Additional information

Quick reference: What to do when...

Here's a quick reference guide on what you should do in various common support-related situations:

When a customer... First, do this: Then, do this:
Asks about an ongoing support ticket (Zendesk) or development ticket (JIRA) Search Zendesk for the relevant support ticket and check for updates If there is no recent update in the ticket, @mention the assigned Support Representative in the ticket's internal comments and ask for an update
Tells you about a new issue they are experiencing with their Uberflip account Search Zendesk to check if there is already a ticket open about this issue for the customer If there is no existing support ticket for the customer, submit one on their behalf
Informs you about a defect in Uberflip's software Search Zendesk and JIRA to check if relevant tickets already exist If there is no existing ticket for the bug, submit a support ticket with a detailed description of the defect (do not create a JIRA ticket)
Asks for guidance on how to do something in Uberflip, and you don't know the answer Search our Knowledge Base for a relevant article If there is no relevant article, submit a support ticket (also, submit a documentation request)
Has in-depth questions about technical aspects of the Uberflip platform (e.g. integrations, SEO, etc.), and you don't know the answers Search our Knowledge Base for a relevant article If there is no relevant article, or our documentation doesn't answer the customer's questions, submit a support ticket (also, submit a documentation request)

 

Using Slack for support

Your fellow Uberflippers have a lot of knowledge about our product, our company, and our customers, and Slack can be a useful tool for accessing that knowledge. Here are a few support-related Slack channels you should know about, and what they're used for:

Important

Remember that support tickets are the only official way to get help from the Support team, and the only one where you're guaranteed to get a response within a specific timeframe.

Members of the Support team are typically present in the channels listed below, but their main job is to work on support tickets, so they may not always be available to respond on Slack.

Channel
 Used for
#success General questions about Uberflip's products, services, customers, and other topics related to Customer Experience.

#support-escalation

 Requesting that a specific ticket, for a specific customer, is given more attention, higher visibility, and a greater sense of urgency. This is the only channel actively monitored by Support.
#onbrand Questions about onBrand-related issues.

 

Submitting development (JIRA) tickets

In general, CSMs should not file JIRA tickets without consulting Support. This includes tickets for:

  • Product bugs
  • onBrand bugs
  • Operations issues

Support helps to refine these tickets, and ensures that Product/Engineering is getting the information they need to work on them, eliminating back-and-forth. In addition, all JIRA tickets filed on behalf of customers need to be attached to support tickets for communication purposes/visibility, and Zendesk users who are not part of the Support team do not have this ability.

If you need to submit a JIRA ticket on behalf of a customer, please make a note of it with details in a comment on an existing Zendesk ticket. If no ticket exists, please file a new Zendesk request with sufficient details to file a JIRA, including:

  • Customer information
  • Affected assets
  • Business impact to customer
  • Steps to reproduce

articles.name: Why can't I see the "Explore From Here" option in Uberflip Analytics?
articles.title: Why can't I see the "Explore From Here" option in Uberflip Analytics?
articles.body:
Question

I want to use Uberflip Analytics Explore, but the Explore From Here option is missing from my Uberflip Analytics interface. Why is that?

 

Answer

To use Uberflip Analytics Explore, your user account needs an Explore license. If your account doesn't have this license, you won't be able to access Explore, and as a result the "Explore From Here" options won't be visible when you use Uberflip Analytics.

Some Uberflip pack types and modules have one or more Explore licenses included, but these may not be assigned to any user account by default. To assign a license to your user account, or to purchase licenses, please speak with your organization's Uberflip administrator, or your Uberflip Customer Success Manager.

articles.name: Use an external consent management platform (CMP) to manage cookie consent on your Hub
articles.title: Use an external consent management platform (CMP) to manage cookie consent on your Hub
articles.body:
If you use a third-party consent management platform to manage cookie consent on your other web properties, you can also configure it to work with your Uberflip Hub. Here's how.

 

Before you begin

  • This article is intended for Uberflip customers who use a consent management platform (CMP) that is external to Uberflip, such as OneTrust, TrustArc, Cookiebot, etc. Ideally you are using this platform with your other web properties already (but this is not strictly necessary).
  • Using an external CMP with your Hub requires developing and implementing custom code that is specific to your organization. As a result, you will need a web developer who is proficient in JavaScript to do this. Your developer should also:
    • Be familiar with your CMP
    • Have worked with custom code on your Uberflip Hub before, or have read the guide to using custom code
  • Before your developer can get started, there are setup steps that must be completed in the Uberflip app. The necessary steps are described in this article. To complete these steps, you need to be an Account Admin or Content Manager.

 

About using a consent management platform with your Hub

To comply with the requirements of GDPR (and similar laws such as CCPA), many businesses rely on consent management platforms (CMPs) to manage visitor cookie consent across their various web properties. If you already use a CMP with your other web properties, you can also use it to manage cookie consent on your Uberflip Hubs through Uberflip's JS Privacy API.

Using the JS Privacy API, you can configure your CMP to control the cookies set by your Uberflip Hub alongside those set by your other web properties. This means that cookie preferences set by a visitor on any of your integrated web properties will also apply to your Hub, and vice versa:

  • If a visitor has already set their cookie preferences on any other web property integrated with your CMP, these preferences will also apply to your Hub(s), and the privacy banner/controls will not appear the first time this visitor enters your Hub
  • If a visitor enters your Hub and has not yet visited any of your other web properties, they will be shown your CMP's privacy banner/controls to set their cookie preferences, and these will also apply when they visit your other web properties

The primary benefit of doing this is that your visitors will only have to set their privacy preferences once, resulting in a more user-friendly experience with less friction across all your web properties.

How does it work?

The most common approach to cookie consent management is to group cookies by their basic function, which allows visitors to opt-in to or opt-out of types of cookies, rather than individually. Most CMPs are based around this "cookie categories" approach, and Uberflip implements the same idea with Privacy Groups. When Privacy Groups are enabled on a Hub, visitors can use the controls on the built-in Privacy Page to manage their cookie preferences by either accepting or declining individual Privacy Groups (and hence all cookies associated with the Privacy Group).

The purpose of the JS Privacy API is to replace this mechanism by linking Uberflip Privacy Groups to the cookie categories in your CMP. Using the API, your CMP can control Uberflip Privacy Groups, opting in or out based on the visitor's existing stored preferences for the equivalent cookie category (i.e. as set on another site). Likewise, you can display your CMP's privacy controls on your Hub, and use the API to sync cookie preferences back your CMP so that they can be applied to other sites.

To use the JS Privacy API, you need to develop a piece of JavaScript custom code that is deployed on your Hub. This code will manage the communication between your CMP and the JS Privacy API, allowing the CMP to get information from Uberflip about your Hub's Privacy Groups and their status for each visitor, and to change their status as needed to match the visitor's existing settings in your CMP (if present). When this code is implemented, your CMP will act as the source of truth: your Hub will always get information about a visitor's privacy preferences from the CMP, and will always send any preferences set on the Hub back to the CMP for storage.

 

Prepare your Hub to connect a CMP

In order to integrate your Hub with a CMP, there are several settings you will need to configure first to ensure the Hub is prepared.

Turn off the Uberflip Privacy Page

Because you will be using an external privacy policy page and the CMP's privacy controls, you need to disable the equivalent Privacy Page feature in Uberflip to avoid conflicts:

  1. Log in to Uberflip.
  2. In the sidebar menu, click on Hub Privacy > Privacy Policy:
  3. In the settings menu, turn off the Enable Privacy Page setting by toggling it to the OFF (grey) position:
  4. Your changes will be saved automatically.

Turn off the Uberflip Privacy Banner

Uberflip also has a built-in privacy banner feature. As you will be using the CMP's privacy banner instead, you must ensure that the built-in Uberflip privacy banner is turned off:

  1. In the sidebar menu, click on Hub Privacy > Privacy Banner:
  2. In the settings menu, turn off the Enable Privacy Banner setting by toggling it to the OFF (grey) position:
  3. Your changes will be saved automatically.

Create and configure Privacy Groups

The JS Privacy API allows the CMP to control your Hub's cookie settings by giving it access to Uberflip's built-in Privacy Groups functionality. As a result, you will need to create and set up Privacy Groups in your Hub if you have not yet done so. Doing this will:

  • Stop your Hub from setting any cookies unless a visitor opts-in, as required by GDPR
  • Group functionally related cookies together so that you can map them equivalent cookie categories in your CMP
  • Provide a mechanism that your CMP can hook into so that it can control which cookies your Hub will set, depending on a visitor's preferences

You can find detailed instructions on how to set up Privacy Groups in this article.

If possible, we recommend structuring your Privacy Groups in the same way as the cookie categories in your CMP, in order to simplify mapping.

Remember that, in addition to creating Privacy Groups, you must also use the Functionality tab to ensure all cookie-setting services in your Hub are assigned to a group:

Map Privacy Groups to equivalent CMP cookie categories

To link your CMP's cookie categories to their corresponding Uberflip Privacy Groups in their code, your developer will need to understand the relationship between the two. For this reason, we recommend that you make a list of both your Uberflip Privacy Groups and the cookie categories in your CMP, then map out which ones are equivalent to one another. For example:

Uberflip Privacy Group name CMP cookie category name
Essential Strictly necessary
Analytics Statistics
... ...

Note that:

  • Each Privacy Group must be mapped to a cookie category in your CMP, as your CMP will not be able to control unmapped Privacy Groups
  • You can map multiple (or even all) Privacy Groups to one cookie category, if needed

 

Develop the CMP integration code

Once this setup work is complete, your developer can begin work on the code that integrates your CMP with your Hub. This involves two pieces of code:

  1. Code to display the CPM's privacy banner/cookie consent controls on your Hub
  2. Code that integrates the Hub with the CPM using the JS Privacy API

To support your developer with this project, instructions, sample code, and API reference materials are provided on Uberflip's developer site, here:

Uberflip Developers: Using the JSPrivacy API

Important

As with all custom development work on your Hub (especially development involving third-party software platforms), Uberflip Support is unable to provide coding support, and may only be able to provide limited troubleshooting assistance.

If you need help with developing this type of solution, please contact your Customer Success Manager to discuss your options for engaging Uberflip Professional Services or an Uberflip Partner.

 

Deploy the code

Once the necessary code has been developed, work with your developer to deploy it on your Hub using Uberflip custom code. As soon as the relevant custom code blocks are active, your CMP will be integrated with your Hub in the same way as with your other web properties.

articles.name: Internal: Pardot Integration missing "Campaign ID" or "Account ID"
articles.title: Internal: Pardot Integration missing "Campaign ID" or "Account ID"
articles.body:
Issue

When editing Pardot integration settings, the "Campaign ID" and/or "Account ID" fields are missing.

  • Pardot Campaign ID or Account ID not shown in settings.
  • Can't see Campaign ID or Account ID for Pardot.
  • Don't see a Campaign ID field.

 

Conditions

  • Issue occurs when editing the settings for a Pardot integration that was previously set up.
  • Where: Pardot integration settings.
  • Who: Any user with access to these settings.
  • When: After saving an existing Pardot integration's settings with the Campaign ID or Account ID fields left blank.
  • Any browser
  • Any operating system

 

Cause

This is due to a bug that occurs when a user removes the existing value(s) from the Campaign ID and/or Account ID fields, then saves the settings while these fields are still empty.

 

Workaround

This workaround will cause the missing fields to reappear without having to deauthorize and reconnect the integration:

  1. Go to the affected Hub's Integrations section and open Pardot integration settings.
  2. Change the email in the Pardot integration settings by adding +1 to the original email. For example, if the email is originalemail@emailhost.com, change this to originalemail+1@emailhost.com.
  3. Save the settings and exit.
  4. Go to the CTA section of the same Hub and create a new Pardot-connected CTA.
  5. The "Connect to Pardot" screen should open. Here, change the email back to the original email address and save again.
  6. Return to the Pardot integration settings, where the Campaign ID and/or Account ID fields should now appear again. Make sure there are values in these fields before saving.

 

Additional Notes

This bug does not occur when initially setting up the integration, because it is not possible to save the integration settings with the Campaign ID or Account ID fields left blank in this situation.

articles.name: Can't find scheduled reports in Uberflip Analytics
articles.title: Can't find scheduled reports in Uberflip Analytics
articles.body:
Issue

I have set up scheduled reports in Uberflip Analytics, but they are not listed under Settings (gear icon) > Schedule.

  • Can't see scheduled reports in Uberflip Analytics
  • Scheduled reports missing in UFA
  • Scheduled reports disappeared

 

Conditions

  • Where: Uberflip Analytics, under Settings (gear icon) > Schedule
  • Who: Users who have created scheduled reports for specific views in Uberflip Analytics
  • When: When trying to find previously created scheduled reports
  • Any browser
  • Which operating systems are affected ("Any operating system" if nonspecific)?

 

Cause

The Settings > Schedule section in Uberflip Analytics is contextual, i.e. it changes based on the dashboard you are currently viewing. If you go to Settings > Schedule while viewing a given dashboard (including the Home dashboard), this will only show scheduled reports for the current dashboard, not for any other dashboards. In other words, if the scheduled dashboard you are looking for was created under another dashboard, it will not appear here. This can make it appear as though your previously created scheduled reports have disappeared.

 

Steps to Fix

  1. In Uberflip, navigate to Uberflip Analytics.
  2. Go the dashboard for which you had created the scheduled report that you're trying to find.
  3. In the top right, click on Settings (gear icon), then click on Schedule.
  4. In the window that appears, scheduled reports created for the current dashboard will appear in the left sidebar.

articles.name: Metadata tab is missing in Edit Article view
articles.title: Metadata tab is missing in Edit Article view
articles.body:
Issue

When creating or editing a post in any type of Stream, the Metadata tab (which appears between the Editor and Tags tabs) does not appear. As a result, settings that are accessed through this tab (Description, URL Path, Thumbnail URL, Author, Status, Publish Date, Hide Publish Date) can't be modified.

  • In the Edit Article view, the Metadata tab is not displayed
  • Can't find Metadata tab
  • Metadata tab hidden
  • Can't update Thumbnail URL

 

Conditions

  • Where: Edit Article view (click Add New Article or Edit Article in a Blog Stream)
  • Any type of Stream
  • Affected user is in the Content Managers and/or Account Administrators user group(s) and/or has been granted the necessary individual permissions to access and work with content Items in the Hub
  • Any browser
  • Any operating system

 

Cause

This is a permissions issue, and happens when the Restricted Content Authoring Experience permission is enabled for a user:

This is a subtractive permission, which removes access rather than granting it. Granting this permission removes the ability to publish posts, so the Publish/Publish Changes buttons is hidden for users who have the permission applied.

All members of the Authors group automatically inherit the Restricted Content Authoring Experience permission. As a result, this issue most often occurs when a user who should have the ability to publish posts (e.g. an Admin or Content Manager) is also added to the Authors group.

 

Steps to Fix

To fix this issue, you must be an Account Administrator.

Primary Solution

  1. Log in to Uberflip and click on your name in the top right corner.
  2. In the menu that appears, click on Account Settings.
  3. In the sidebar menu on the left, click on Organization to expand that menu section, then click on Users.
  4. In the list of users, find the user who is experiencing the issue and click on their name.
  5. You should be on the User Information tab for the user. Below the Groups dropdown, you should see the list of groups the user is currently in:
  6. If you see the Authors group on this list, click on the x button to the right of Authors:
    • If you don't see Authors listed here, go to the Secondary Solution below.
  7. The Authors group will be removed from the list, indicating that the user has been removed from that group. This should resolve the issue.

Secondary Solution

  1. If you do not see the Authors group listed under the User Information tab, click on the Permissions tab.
  2. Scroll down until you find the permission named Restricted Content Authoring Experience (you can use Ctrl+F/Command+F to search).
  3. Uncheck the box next to Restricted Content Authoring Experience:
  4. This should resolve the issue.

 

Additional Notes

The Restricted Content Authoring Experience permission also causes the Publish/Publish Changes button in the Article Editor to be hidden.

Note also that the Metadata tab is supposed to be hidden for users in the Authors group — this is intentional behavior.

articles.name: Announcement: Retiring Adobe Flash Flipbooks
articles.title: Announcement: Retiring Adobe Flash Flipbooks
articles.body:
We will be removing Adobe Flash-based Flipbooks from the Uberflip platform on December 31, 2020. Learn why we're doing this, and how it affects you.

Important

This announcement is for an event that has already happened. It remains available for reference purposes only.

What's changing?

Adobe has announced that they will "end-of-life" Flash Player on December 31, 2020. As a result, Uberflip's Flash-based Flipbooks viewer will stop working on January 1, 2021, and we will be removing the Flash-based Flipbooks viewer functionality from the Uberflip platform in early January.

Only customers who are still using Flash Flipbooks are affected by this change. As of January 1, 2021, any Flipbooks that are still set up to use the Flash Flipbooks viewer will remain accessible, but visitors must choose to use the alternative HTML5-based Flipbooks viewer instead. To provide a better user experience, we strongly recommend configuring your Flipbooks to automatically open in the HTML5 viewer before this date. Please read on for further details.

Additionally, note that some features which were available with Adobe Flash-based Flipbooks are not available with (or not applicable to) HTML5-based Flipbooks. Please refer to the Additional information section for a full list.

 

Why is Uberflip making this change?

In July 2017, Adobe announced their plan to end-of-life Flash Player by December 31, 2020. After this date, Adobe will consider Flash Player a "dead" technology, and will no longer distribute, update, or support it. Adobe will also prompt all remaining users to uninstall Flash Player, and will block Flash Player from displaying content after the end-of-life date even if it remains installed. For these reasons, Uberflip can no longer support the Flash-based version of the Flipbooks viewer, and must retire it.

We understand that some of our customers are still using Flash-based Flipbooks, and will be disappointed by this news. However, better and more secure technologies (i.e. HTML5) have largely replaced Flash on the web, and most browser vendors have blocked Flash by default for several years now. In fact, Uberflip has already partly deprecated Flash Flipbooks: due to the increasing number of web users who do not have Flash (including mobile users), Uberflip has for some time now offered an alternative HTML5 version whenever a Flash Flipbook is displayed.

Although Uberflip has supported the Flash-based Flipbooks viewer for as long as possible, the writing is on the wall: with the end-of-life date set by Adobe, Uberflip has no choice but to retire Flash-based Flipbooks at the end of 2020.

 

Who is affected by this change?

This change only affects customers who are still using Flash-based Flipbooks, i.e. those who have Flipbook Folders set to the Flash on Desktop/HTML5 on Mobile setting. 

Customers who are only using non-Flash Flipbooks types (i.e. HTML5, HTML5 (SVG) and Native PDF) are not affected by this change.

 

Does this mean I can't use Flipbooks at all anymore?

The Flipbooks product is not going away: you will still be able to create and publish Flipbooks using any of the other available options, i.e. HTML5, HTML5 (SVG), and Native PDF. Only the Adobe Flash option is being retired.

 

What do I need to do to prepare?

After December 31, 2020, your visitors will still be able to view Flipbooks configured to use the Flash-based viewer, but the viewer itself will no longer work. Instead, visitors must manually select the backup HTML5 option to view any Flash-based Flipbook:

This experience may be confusing to your visitors. As a result, we strongly recommend that you switch your Flash Flipbooks Folders to the HTML5 setting as soon as possible. This will automatically launch your Flipbooks in the HTML5 viewer, providing a much smoother experience for your visitors.

To make the switch, simply change the Reader Version dropdown on any applicable Folder from Flash on Desktop/HTML5 on Mobile:

 To HTML5:

The change will take effect immediately, and Flipbooks within that Folder will now automatically open in the HTML5 viewer right away.

(You may also choose a different option, but we recommend using the HTML5 option as it is the closest equivalent to Flash Flipbooks.)

Because certain features of Flash Flipbooks are not available in HTML5, we also recommend that you review the Additional information section (below) prior to December 31, in order to understand how your and your visitors' experience may change.

 

What will happen if I don't do anything?

As noted above, Flipbooks set to use the Flash viewer will still be viewable with HTML5 after December 31, but the user experience will not be ideal.

In addition, Uberflip will be retiring the Flash Flipbooks technology from our platform by January 15. In practical terms, this means that the Flash on Desktop/HTML5 on Mobile option will be removed from the product, and it will no longer be possible to create new Folders with this setting, or to enable this setting on existing Folders. At the same time, any Flipbooks Folders that are still set to the Flash on Desktop/HTML5 on Mobile setting will be switched to the HTML5 setting automatically.

Note

Flipbooks Folders that are already set to HTML5, HTML5 (SVG), or Native PDF will not be affected by this change in any way.

 

Additional information

The HTML5 Flipbooks viewer supports the vast majority of features that were present in the Flash Flipbooks viewer. However, certain specific features are not available. These are primarily features that Uberflip has retired because they were not widely used, or were no longer necessary/applicable with HTML5.

The main features from Flash Flipbooks that were not implemented in HTML5 Flipbooks are:

  • The Custom Embed widget (sidebar displaying custom code)
  • The Interface Language option (an option to change the language of the Flipbooks viewer UI)
  • The My Account tab (an options tab displayed in the Flipbooks viewer UI as part of Subscribers functionality)
  • Various Flash-specific Desktop Flipbooks toolbar functions and options
  • Various Flash-specific PDF-to-Flipbook processing options

Below is a detailed breakdown of the Flash Flipbooks viewer features that are not available in the HTML5 Flipbooks viewer. Any workarounds or alternatives are noted where available.

 

Settings: Basics > Options

These settings are related to language options for Flipbooks. The overall feature has been retired, as the HTML5 viewer has few text labels, and does not have text tooltips.

Flash Feature Description HTML5 Alternative
Interface Language Sets the language of the Flipbooks interface (toolbar labels and text tooltops) None (retired feature)

 

Settings: Basics > Options > Desktop Flipbook Options

These settings are related to the behavior of the Flash Flipbooks viewer on desktop, in particular the toolbar shown at the top. Some portions of this feature have been retired, while for others, equivalent functionality is available in the HTML5 viewer or the browser.

Flash Feature Description HTML5 Alternative
Enable crop, print/save tool Makes the Crop tool available in the toolbar Replaced with screenshot functionality (browser or third-party tool)
Allow downloading selected pages Makes the Download selected pages tool available in the toolbar Replaced with Allow downloading original PDF option
Allow printing Makes the Print tool available in the toolbar If Allow downloading original PDF option is enabled, users can download and print PDF
Enable page-turning sound effect Makes a sound effect play when a Flipbook page is turned None (retired feature)
Enable the links list Makes the Links tool available in the toolbar None (retired feature)
Hide bottom thumbnail navigation Removes the thumbnail preview images of next/previous Flipbook pages shown at the bottom of the viewer None (retired feature)
Page flipping speed Sets the speed of the page turn animation None (retired feature)
Page flip effect Sets the type of effect used for the page turn animation Replaced with a more modern "slide" effect
Default Zoom Level  Sets the initial zoom level of the Flipbook when it is displayed None (retired feature)

 

Settings: Widgets > Custom Embed

These settings are related to the Custom Embed widget, a banner shown to the left of the Flash Flipbooks viewer that can contain custom HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The overall feature has been retired.

Flash Feature Description HTML5 Alternative
Your Embed Code Specifies the code to be displayed in the embed widget banner None (retired feature)
Specify a width Determines the width of the embed widget banner None (retired feature)
Activate the custom embed widget Enables the embed widget banner None (retired feature)

Tip

The Custom Embed widget was designed for an experience in which Flipbooks are displayed in the standalone Flipbooks viewer. We no longer recommend this, as it is bad for SEO. Instead, we recommend embedding the Flipbooks viewer in another webpage. Doing this also eliminates the need for the Custom Embed widget, as you can simply place the same content onto the page where the Flipbooks viewer is embedded.

 

Settings: Advanced > Parser Defaults

These settings are related to the Flash Flipbooks parser, which analyzes PDF content and processes it into a Flash Flipbook. Because these particular settings are not applicable to the HTML5 Flipbooks parser, they have been removed.

Flash Feature Description HTML5 Alternative
Default Image DPI Sets the quality level of images processed from a PDF into a Flash Flipbook All images rendered at 300 DPI and 100% quality by default
Force Vectorization of Complex Objects Sets the page size threshold to turn complex objects present in the source PDF into vector images Use the HTML5 (SVG) Flipbooks Folder option to convert PDF text and shapes into vector images

articles.name: SnapApp: Analytics defined
articles.title: SnapApp: Analytics defined
articles.body:
Info

SnapApp is being retired. This product and all of its features will be shutting down on Aug. 1st 2022. For more information, check out Announcement: Retiring SnapApp.

Performance Data Tracked For Each App

Measurable Data Definition
Page Loads Every time app is loaded, including after a page refresh. If the page refreshes because it gets a callback from the SnapApp and refreshes itself, that does not get counted.
Impressions Counts initial loads of a SnapApp only, not loads after a page refresh.
Mouse-Over Number of times someone initially hovered over a SnapApp.
Mouse-Over Rate % of impressions that resulted in a mouse-over (MO / Imp).
Clicks Initial clicks.
Click Rate % of impressions that resulted in a click (Click / Imp).
Question Completion Number of times the last question was answered.
Question Completion Rate Number of clicks that resulted in question completions (Q. Comp. / Click).
Lead Form Impressions Number of times the lead form was seen.
Lead Submissions Number of times the lead form was submitted.
Lead Submission Rate Lead Submissions per Lead Impressions (Lead Sub. / Lead Imp).
Auto Lead Signups Number of times lead form was submitted automatically via advanced marketing automation.
Completions Number of times a user reaches Results page.
Completion Rate Completions per Clicks (Comp. / Click).
Linkout Clickthroughs Number of external link clicks.
Linkout Clickthrough Rate Linkout clickthroughs per initial Clicks (Link Click / Initial Clicks).
Share Actions Number of times a user shared result (non-unique). This is an aggregate of all share button clicks.
Share Rate Share Action per Completions (Share / Comp).
Share Referrals Number of users who reached app via link shared by previous user.
Referrals per Share Share Referrals per Share Actions (Referrals / Share).
Viral Boost Percentage Traffic to app from share referrals.
Facebook Shares Number of times Facebook share button was clicked on Results page.
Tweets Number of times Twitter share button was clicked on Results page.
Google+ Shares Number of times Google +1 share button was clicked on Results page.
LinkedIn Shares Number of times LinkedIn share button was clicked on Results page.
Facebook Likes Number of times Facebook Like button was clicked.
Like Rate Facebook Likes per Completions (Follows / Comp).
Twitter Follow Rate Twitter Follows per Completions (Follows / Comp).
Google +1s Number of times Google +1 button was clicked.
Google +1 Rate Google +1s per Completions (+1s / Comp).
YouTube Subscribers Number of times users click the YouTube subscribe button.
YouTube Subscribe Rate YouTube subscribers per Completions (Subscribers / Comp).

 

Types of Lead Data SnapApp Can Collect

  • Lead Form Information: You can customize your SnapApp lead forms to capture whatever lead data you want, including name, email, phone number, etc. SnapApp lead forms can also capture the IP address and submission data of each lead record.
  • Question & Result Data: The responses each end-user provides to the questions in the SnapApp, as well as the final result they receive, can be included as part of each lead record.
  • Hidden Field Data: SnapApp lead forms can include hidden fields that can be used to track things like the source URL of each lead, query string parameters such as UTM codes, a unique SnapApp ID number for each app, and other information not provided directly by the end-user.
  • Advanced Marketing Automation Info: If you’re using Eloqua or Marketo, the SnapApp advanced marketing automation feature allows for the automatic submission of lead forms for known users in your MAP database. You can also track known users who only partially complete the app through this feature

articles.name: SnapApp: 10 best practices for SnapApp
articles.title: SnapApp: 10 best practices for SnapApp
articles.body:
Info

SnapApp is being retired. This product and all of its features will be shutting down on Aug. 1st 2022. For more information, check out Announcement: Retiring SnapApp.

Learn what the 10 best practices are when using SnapApp 

 

SnapApp helps marketers take the guesswork out of getting great leads. Whether youʼre just getting started or just need a refresher, there are a few rules of thumb to keep in mind.

 

Best practice 1: Ask qualifying questions

Why?

The greatest value from SnapApp is learning something about your prospects that you can only get by asking. Asking the right questions can help engage and convert a prospect into a lead, give them a more personalized journey, and improve lead quality.

While you have their attention, ask prospects something that will help you follow up with the right nurture stream, or send them to sales based on their intent.

 

Best practice 2: Save questions in question bank

Why?

There is no limit to how many questions you can ask, but in order for response data to be useful, consistency in how you ask is critical. Question bank gives you a single location to store and manage your questions. You can also organize them by categories, or set the order in which they should be displayed in apps that use progressive questions.

 

Best practice 3: Connect to a Marketing Automation tool

Why?

SnapApp integrates with most marketing automation platforms so you can make lead response data actionable. Connecting SnapApp to marketing automation ensures that lead data is passed immediately and seamlessly to your system of record, and you can use responses to segment and prioritize leads, add them to workflows and cadences, and create smart lists. 

 

Best practice 4: Keep design simple 

Why?

One personʼs delightful engaging experience is someone elseʼs confusing interruption. SnapApp has one mission: to help you know more about your leads. By keeping questions front and center, and designing to blend into your website and content, our apps remove barriers between you and the prospect, and the information exchange that can lead to a business relationship.
